By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, the PayPal platform is empowering more than 400 million consumers and merchants in more than 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy. For more information, visit paypal.com.
PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.

As part of PayPal’s commitment to employees’ health and safety, we have established in-office Covid-19 protocols and requirements, based on expert guidance. Depending on location, this might include a Covid-19 vaccination requirement for any employee whose role requires them to work onsite. Employees may request reasonable accommodation based on a medical condition or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated. At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives.
Job Description Summary: Global Investigations is looking for a highly talented, self-motivated, and analytical individual to join the Cyber Fraud Investigations Team. The mission of the Cyber Fraud Investigations Team is to ensure the financial and reputational resiliency of PayPal and its subsidiaries through the resolution of complex investigations into incidents of fraud. This role provides an opportunity to work alongside leading investigations professionals in collaboration with law enforcement, private sector partners, and a broad array of internal stakeholders.
Job Description:
Responsibilities include:
Identify complex fraud patterns and their technical root causes through detailed data mining and analysis, including identification of sophisticated fraud methods employed by actors who are deliberately trying to avoid detection.
Join data between platforms to track disparate fraud signals and develop a holistic view of fraud trends across PayPal’s adjacencies.
Expand upon investigative fraud stories by developing statistics and data visualizations to quantify and broadly assess the impact of common root causes on the platform.
Serve as technical SME for CFI by sharing new data mining techniques, maintaining technical reference documentation, and interfacing with partner technology teams.
Collaborate across business and technology stakeholders to communicate analytic findings succinctly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Provide technical guidance for engineering projects that incorporate new data points into the investigation team’s toolkit, such as API integrations or internal data transformations.
Requirements:
Successful track record of owning and driving large, complex data analysis projects.
High level of theoretical and practical expertise in data mining and database technologies.
Advanced understanding of financially motivated cybercrime trends and typologies.
Demonstrated capacity for innovation and outside-the-box thinking in the creation of new capabilities and processes that are unstructured or exploratory in nature.
Proven ability to develop effective, cross-organization relationships, collaborating and communicating across business and technology stakeholders and multiple geographies.
Team player, energetic personality, curious, quality minded, focused, committed, able to work efficiently in a fast paced, changing environment.
Basic Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in analytics or data-driven investigations
Bachelor’s or Advanced degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field
Proficient in one or more major programming languages (SAS, R, Matlab, Python, Java, Perl, etc.)
Advanced SQL knowledge
Our Benefits:
At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com

We are looking for ambitious apprentices to join our talented team. This is an excellent opportunity for you to join a dynamic and innovative team working on exciting data projects in a number of different industries. We provide a supportive, fun working environment to help support our staff to deliver the highest quality results and commercial value to our clients.
Apply now
The 9 month apprenticeship programme will be broken into 3 stages. At the end of each stage apprentices will be evaluated on a go/no go basis. For the second and third stages a stipend will be paid. The apprentice will be assigned an Idiro mentor and will receive training in different areas such as data mining and its application to business problem solving. At the end of 9 months, successful apprentices will be considered for full time employment with the company.
Objective of apprenticeship
Develop a deep understanding of how data science can be applied to business and the world around us.
Learn how to manipulate, transform and wrangle data from different data sources.
Become proficient in real-world data science and the many and varied modelling techniques and technologies that make data science possible.
Engage with internal and external clients and master how to present and discuss the outcomes of data mining and predictive modelling with a wide variety of stakeholders.
Expectations
You posses a drive to further your skills and work on exciting data analytics projects.
You are familiar with tools such as R, Python, SAS, Tableau or Qlik as well as having worked with SQL and relational databases.
Good communication and presentation skills as well as excellent written and spoken English.
You must be eligible to work in the EU.
Having knowledge of Linux, Java and Red Sqirl would be an advantage.
Please send your CV to jobs@idiro.com.

IT Security Data Scientist
Location: Dublin, Ireland
Are you looking for new challenges around Artificial Intelligence? Would you like to build mathematical models based on big data analytics, to make predictions or decisions without human intervention? Do you want to work using Cloud, DevOps and big Data Platforms?
If so, this is a phenomenal opportunity to be part of a new and growing team, to build strong skills in the latest data mining field and to work with amazing people!
You will be a member of a continually collaborating development team who is focused on providing vital support to rapidly improve cyber defense functions. Your focus will be on the development of modular orchestrations that can be creatively used in different ways by different teams. You will have the opportunity to pivot from detailed workflow design to concept engineering for new orchestrations, to investigative analysis of data flow needs to best predict risks.
Responsibilities:
Building Proof-of-Concept models using Machine Learning techniques.
Passion in applying AI to address Information Security issues and motivated to learn new technologies including AI, Cloud, Data Science, etc.
Develop, construct, test and maintain architecture
Align architecture with business requirements
Data acquisition and develop data set processes
Use programming language and tools
Identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality
Conduct research for industry and business questions
Use large data sets to address business issues
Deploy sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning and statistical methods
Prepare data for predictive and prescriptive modelling
Find hidden patterns using data
Use data to discover tasks that can be automated
Deliver updates to partners based on analytics
Being able to advance issues, as appropriate, when business needs of collaborators are impeded. Provide status and updates to supervisor

Qualifications & Experience:
BSc or higher degree in a computer science, software engineering, data science, analytics, technology, information security, business or project management related field.
Experience working on technology related projects.
Experience using Spark, Azure, Casandra, Elastic Search, Python, Pandas
Good understanding of business applications and software.
Experience within Compliance internal controls would be helpful, but not crucial.
Does this appeal to you? If so, we would love to hear from you.
Please advise if you have any particular requirements, so we can look into arranging reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process. You can contact us at accessIErecruitment@accenture.com.
What’s in it for you:
At Accenture Ireland, in addition to a competitive base salary, you will also have an extensive benefits package which includes pension, private health insurance, discounted gym membership, 2 types of bonus, emergency caring facilities, 20 days of holidays and 2 days’ leave per year for charitable work of your choice! Flexible working arrangements can be discussed depending on the position.
Accenture is a leading international professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and niche skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions—underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network—Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and build value for their partners. With approximately 373,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com

Your focus will be on the development of modular orchestrations that can be creatively used in different ways by different teams. You will have the opportunity to pivot from detailed workflow design to concept engineering for new orchestrations, to investigative analysis of data flow needs to best predict risks.
Responsibilities:
Building Proof-of-Concept models using Machine Learning techniques.
Passion in applying AI to address Information Security issues and motivated to learn new technologies including AI, Cloud, Data Science, etc.
Develop, construct, test and maintain architecture
Align architecture with business requirements
Data acquisition and develop data set processes
Use programming language and tools
Identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality
Conduct research for industry and business questions
Use large data sets to address business issues
Deploy sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning and statistical methods
Prepare data for predictive and prescriptive modelling
Find hidden patterns using data
Use data to discover tasks that can be automated
Deliver updates to partners based on analytics
Being able to advance issues, as appropriate, when business needs of collaborators are impeded. Provide status and updates to supervisor

Qualifications & Experience:
BSc or higher degree in a computer science, software engineering, data science, analytics, technology, information security, business or project management related field.
Experience working on technology related projects.
Experience using Spark, Azure, Casandra, Elastic Search, Python, Pandas
Good understanding of business applications and software.
Experience within Compliance internal controls would be helpful, but not crucial.

Data Analytics at EY
Data Analytics is one of the most exciting fields in today’s digital world. It offers challenging work, career development and great job satisfaction. EY’s mission is to build a better working world by asking better questions and finding better answers – this is what data analytics is all about. What better way to help us achieve our mission than by working with our data science teams as we continue on this journey.
Data Analytics is one of our strategic growth platforms with plans to grow from 150 people today to over 200 in the next 2 years. We are transforming our business by embedding analytics in everything we do. We are helping our clients transform their businesses by doing the same, across industry sectors and lines of business. We are growing and so are our people. We are hiring experienced professionals and graduates to work in a variety of roles. Apply today.
Data Science Senior/Consultant | Data Analytics
Who are we?
At EY our purpose is to Build a Better Working World. We believe that the highest-performing teams maximize the power of different perspectives and backgrounds. These teams are both diverse and inclusive and are willing to invite and learn from other perspectives. Our ability to include various viewpoints into our mindsets, behaviours and operations is fundamental to driving innovation, building strong relationships and delivering the best solutions for our clients.
Our data analytics team focuses on helping our clients unlock value from their information assets through collaboration with domain experts across assurance, tax, transactions and consulting to embed innovative data analytics solutions in existing business areas.
The Opportunity
In response to strong market demand, we are seeking additional individuals to enhance our existing team. This is a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the Data Analytics team who are not only changing how we deliver services to our clients but are also committed to creating a diverse environment where EY people are valued, where they feel they belong and can contribute their best in every encounter.
Your Role and Responsibilities
Helping clients unlock value from their information assets through collaboration with domain experts to embed innovative data analytics solutions in existing business areas
Ability to take initiative and derive innovative solutions tailoring our insights and solutions to specific industry, sector and regulatory dynamics.
Collaborating effectively with multi-disciplinary teams across a range of industries helping our clients to transform and improve their business
Responsibility for a robust set of tools and infrastructure to sanitize, store and manipulate data (following leading standards for data security and privacy).
Performing statistical analysis and modelling using a variety of tools and programming languages and tell compelling stories to our clients through the application of Data Visualisation software
Applying predictive modelling techniques to key business issues faced by our clients that can transform and improve their entire organisation
Skills and attributes for success
Previous experience in a consulting or industry role
Strong academic record including a degree in a relevant, analytical discipline with an interest in data and a willingness to learn new skills and technologies
Effective communication skills with the ability to explain complex information using clear non-technical language
Continuously builds and masters key technical, functional and professional skills
A passion to contribute to the growth of the team, bringing energy, enthusiasm and the courage to lead and develop others
Demonstrates ability to direct and lead the activities of junior team members
Naturally inquisitive and analytically minded with the passion and ability to apply new techniques and knowledge to deliver insights and solve problems
Experience using any of the following programming languages such as R, Python; data manipulation tools including SQL or Data Visualisation software like Qlikview, PowerBI or Tableau.
What we offer
We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions.
ontinuous learning:
You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
As you grow and develop here, you’ll discover opportunities to help customise your career journey, so that it’s as unique as you are.
Success as defined by you:
We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
We have embraced Hybrid working at EY adding greater flexibility and autonomy to the roles of our employees
Transformative leadership:
We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture:
Diversity is about differences. You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
CIPD 2020 Diversity and Inclusion Winner, GreatPlaceToWork’s Top 20 UK’s Best Workplaces for Women 2020 (Super Large Category) And Times Top 50 Employers for Women 2019 & 2020
To hear stories from professionals within our business around their experience, career advice and progression, and belonging and flexibility please visit us here.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect.
Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect.
The Industrial and Multi-markets group is looking for an experienced Data Scientist, passionate about building business data models as part of the digital transformation of our own business.
Collaborating with key people across the organisation, you will be responsible for developing and implementing new methodologies using statistics, modelling, and experimentation for delivering data driven insights to accelerate growth of the business and improve customer experience. You will be using cutting-edge data science techniques to process, creatively analyse and model large volumes of complex data.
Key Responsibilities
Working as part of a cross-functional team to develop project requirements, identifying data collection sources for project needs. Responsible for milestone setting from data science perspective.
Processing, cleansing, and integrating data from both structured and unstructured databases.
Work with different data sources from different dimensional and time series databases to identify trends and provide reports with recommendations to generate new insights.
Prepare the data, working with incomplete datasets and tabular data, including an understanding of feature engineering and feature importance.
Build relationships across a large multi-national organisation
Contribute insights and recommendations for the development of new business metrics and dashboards.
Key Requirements
BSc or higher degree in a data science/ analytics related field.
Proven track record of coding experience in Python or R (preferred) required, experience exploring and visualizing data using Plotly, Seaborn and/or Dash beneficial.
Excellent communication skills required – the ability to synthesise the information for a particular audience and present the key insights from the data analysis.
Experience with SQL, PowerBI or Qlikview beneficial.
Experience with Machine Learning, NLP and time-series in particular would be beneficial.
For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process.
Analog Devices, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability

Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. Sense of ownership, evidence of dealing with ambiguity & ability to drive consensus around key decisions.
Data science background (MS or equivalent in Statistics, Applied Math, OR, Economics, or a related quantitative field; or, BS + 5 yrs experience).
3+ years of experience with data scripting languages (e.g Python). Experience in handling large data sets using SQL and databases in a business environment.
Skilled in a quantitative data science discipline (e.g., statistics, econometrics, time series analysis, stochastic modelling, machine learning).
Able to use a range of data science methodologies to conduct analysis for cases when the solution approach is unclear that relate to a portion of a business or business process.
Experience with fast prototyping.
Familiarity with scrum/agile task tracking (e.g. Asana, JIRA, Confluence, etc.).

Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, and technology.

As the Data Scientist on the Analytics GTM Tools team, you have the exciting opportunity to help create new and innovative experiences for customers as they adopt and scale some of the most popular AWS Analytics Services. We are looking for a data scientist to design and build personalized and prescriptive customer experiences that span multiple customer use cases and Amazon web services. You have expertise in a range of data science methodologies. You combine this knowledge with a deep understanding of the business area your team focuses on, incorporating expertise from engineers and other subject matter experts to create pragmatic solutions. You design and implement scalable and reliable approaches to extract the best information possible from the data. You develop metrics to quantify the benefits of a solution and influence project resources. You work closely with sales teams and product/service teams to help them evolve the products/services and address issues, concerns, and requests from customers and the field. Join our quickly growing team that spans Europe and US.

Key job responsibilities

You independently own and solve difficult business problems. These may be well-defined problems where the solution has not yet been outlined or approach to solve is unclear.
Gather and use complex data set across domains. You proactively gather data when it is not readily available.
Employ a range of data science methods, tools, and best practices. You are able to justify your approach.
Write clear and factually correct documents explaining technical concept to non-technical audience.
Ensure software is secure, accessible, maintainable, scalable, performant, and operationally excellent. Solutions that are testable and reproducible.
Collect metrics after product launch to evaluate designs and make informed improvements on user experience.
Work closely with senior engineers, UX designers, and product managers to design and build intuitive, accessible, and innovative products that delight thousands of users.
Help define and improve design best practices, including but not limited to defining and refining design patterns, standards, methods, and processes.
Serve as a key member of the Analytics Platform Specialists team focused on helping customers accelerate their data-driven transformation.

Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.
Experience collaborating with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders.
Experience performing user research and/or gathering quantitative customer data.
Experience with AWS AI/ML and Serverless technologies is a plus.
Verbal and written communications skills, as well as leadership skills.

Sense of ownership, evidence of dealing with ambiguity & ability to drive consensus around key decisions.
Data science background (MS or equivalent in Statistics, Applied Math, OR, Economics, or a related quantitative field; or, BS + 5 yrs experience).
3+ years of experience with data scripting languages (e.g Python). Experience in handling large data sets using SQL and databases in a business environment.
Skilled in a quantitative data science discipline (e.g., statistics, econometrics, time series analysis, stochastic modelling, machine learning).
Able to use a range of data science methodologies to conduct analysis for cases when the solution approach is unclear that relate to a portion of a business or business process.
Experience with fast prototyping.
Familiarity with scrum/agile task tracking (e.g. Asana, JIRA, Confluence, etc.).

Job Title
Advanced Manufacturing – Data Analytics Manager
Service Line
Data Analytics
Location
Limerick / Cork
Data Analytics at EY
Data Analytics is one of the most exciting fields in today’s digital world. It offers challenging work, career development and great job satisfaction. EY’s mission is to build a better working world by asking better questions and finding better answers – this is what data science is all about. What better way to help us achieve our mission than by working with our data science teams as we continue on this journey.
Data Analytics is one of our strategic growth platforms with plans to grow from 150 people today to 200 over the next year. We are transforming our business by embedding analytics in everything we do. We are helping our clients transform their businesses by doing the same, across industry sectors and lines of business. We are growing and so are our people.
We are striving to bring our Advanced Manufacturing capabilities to the next level and are looking for manager candidates to join our team. If you are interested in this opportunity, apply today.
Who are we?
Our data analytics team focuses on helping our clients unlock value from their information assets through collaboration with domain experts across assurance, tax, transactions and advisory to embed innovative data analytics solutions in existing services lines.
In response to strong market demand, we are seeking additional individuals to enhance our existing teams in Cork, Limerick and in Dublin. This is a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the data analytics practice who are changing how we deliver services to our clients.
Role Description:
Lead projects within our Advanced Manufacturing and Supply Chain Data Analytics capability and contribute to the overall growth of the Advance Manufacturing capability
Work with clients to define, build and integrate a series of analytics use cases to improve their manufacturing and supply chain performance
Become a strategic team member in the roll out of our Advanced Manufacturing strategy, which will include technology focus, standards, culture and ways of working to align with the overall Analytics growth strategy
Contribute to the growth of the Advanced Manufacturing Data Analytics team to ensure it has the right capability and capacity to meet client demand
Strategically leverage networks to drive innovation, best practice and a continuous improvement culture across advanced manufacturing and aligned with EY’s wider Digital Factory capability
Build key relationships across internal and client stakeholders to help define and deliver the data engineering component of analytics solutions that will deliver business value
What we look for?
Relevant experience in consulting or industry with a minimum of 5 years of experience
Strong academic record including a degree /MSc/PhD in either: Mathematics / Statistics / Computer Science / Engineering.
Minimum 18 months’ on your current passport for Work Permit & Visa applications (if applicable) Job Title

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Here in DX Compliance, we are changing the way anti-money laundering is done, by using AI Led software to detect suspicious behavior that potentially proceeds to crime or the financing of terrorism.

JOB OVERVIEW
We’re looking for a data scientist to join our growing team, who is willing to take the responsibility for developing a product based on AI and Machine learning.
The ideal candidate will work with the product team to perform analysis on large sets of data and to extract actionable insights. The candidate will have an impact by communicating predictions and findings to the candidate’s team, product managers and stakeholders through effective data visualisations and reports.


KEY RESPONSIBILTIES


Work with stakeholders throughout the organisation to identify opportunities for leveraging client’s compliance requirements with the provided data.
Transactional behavior patterns must be mined from the data.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modelling to increase and optimise the current rule-based systems.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyse model performance and data accuracy.
Assist the clients with the data driven solutions and explaining the proof of concepts.
Recruit new people to our Data Science Team together with HR where it makes sense
Assist the founders with Hakathon Ideas.


TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS

Experience in Python.
Experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, text mining, social network analysis.
Proven experience in graph databases and graph algorithms (Neo4j).
Experience using AWS to deploy and train the machine learning models at large scale.
Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modelling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
Experience in graph learning would be a great add on.
Proven work experience with web crawlers and natural language processing.
Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: D3.js.


BENEFITS

Pension scheme
Laptop of your choice
Monthly social events and team offsite
Free fruit, cookies, tea/coffee throughout the week
Regular networking events, mentoring events and conferences
Exposure to experts from a number of industries
Freedom to explore the latest tools and technologies
Knowledge-sharing activities

Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect.
Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect.
The Industrial and Multi-markets group is looking for an experienced Sr. Data Scientist, passionate about building business data models as part of the digital transformation of our own business.
Collaborating with key people across the organisation, you will be responsible for developing and implementing new methodologies using statistics, modelling, and experimentation for delivering data driven insights to accelerate growth of the business and improve customer experience. You will be using cutting-edge data science techniques to process, creatively analyse and model large volumes of complex data.
Key Responsibilities
Working as part of a cross-functional team to develop project requirements, identifying data collection sources for project needs. Responsible for milestone setting from data science perspective.
Processing, cleansing, and integrating data from both structured and unstructured databases.
Work with different data sources from different dimensional and time series databases to identify trends and provide reports with recommendations to generate new insights.
Prepare the data, working with incomplete datasets and tabular data, including an understanding of feature engineering and feature importance.
Build relationships across a large multi-national organisation
Contribute insights and recommendations for the development of new business metrics and dashboards.
Key Requirements
MSc or higher degree in a data science/ analytics, statistics, mathematics related field.
Demonstrated track record of coding experience in SQL and either Python (preferred) or R is required, experience exploring and visualizing data using Plotly, Seaborn and/or Dash beneficial.
Focus on execution and results – establishing high standards for performance, follow through on plans.
Strong business acumen with strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills required – the ability to synthesise the information for a particular audience and present the key insights from the data analysis.
Experience with SQL, PowerBI or Qlikview beneficial.
Experience with Machine Learning, NLP and time-series in particular would be beneficial.
For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process.

Innovation, adaptability and a passion for innovation and problem solving. If those traits brought you here, this opportunity can take you much further. We are using great data to uncover new solutions and novel marketplace opportunities. If you thrive on making an impact in an evolving market, we should be talking. Join us and start doing your life's best work.
Data Scientists working within Optum RQPE Data Science R&D team are developing cutting edge analytical products from one of the world’s richest healthcare dataset. You will be at the intersection of business, technology and data science.
Careers with Optum offer flexible work arrangements and individuals who live and work in the Republic of Ireland will have the opportunity to split their monthly work hours between our Dublin office and telecommuting from a home-based office.
Primary Responsibilities:
Be an independent thinker and advocate of data science methods and applications
Research, develop and apply new innovative analytics methods and technologies from other domains to healthcare data
The ability for critical thinking outside your immediate sphere of responsibility
Work with autonomy and in partnership with other Data Scientists to find solutions to complex problems
Leverage technical / analytical expertise across the enterprise to architect, deploy and oversee analytics and technology solutions
Prototype new products and solutions that have the capability to transform the industry
Ability to articulate and paint a vision, with strong communication and presentation skills, as well as strengths in translating highly complex concepts, results, models and technologies in ways that can be understood by a variety of audiences
Be familiar with the state-of-the-art around big data analytics and associated technologies and techniques
Have experience with Commercial environments and/or Products (not just internal focused)
Be a leader for a variety of projects including proofs of concept, new product / component development, and reengineering initiatives among others.
Work as part of a small team, sharing ideas and contributing to the strategic goals.
Required Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree in engineering/computer/statistics
Experience in analytics / data science in a business or academic context
Demonstrated experience using programming to solve complex technical problems
Demonstrated experience accessing data from various data environments
Preferred Qualifications:
Masters degree pr PhD in a technical field (e.g. computer science, science, engineering, math / stats, physics etc.)
Core knowledge of statistics, machine-learning and numerical / computational methods with experience in the application of these methods to business problems
Extensive programming experience with Python/Pyspark or other analytics languages
Experience working within a software development team and using version control systems such as Git..
Experience of large-scale distributed computing environments (Hadoop, Hive, Databricks etc)
Experience developing analytical solutions on cloud computing platforms i.e. Azure
Experience applying deep learning methods to business problems using TensorFlow, Keras, etc.
Experience with supervised and unsupervised learning methods for model build and deployment
Experience applying computational algorithms and statistical methods to structured and unstructured data
Experience of the US Healthcare sector
Careers with United Health Group. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective: make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

The Opportunity:
Shutterstock is a technology company that powers one of the world's largest two-sided marketplaces for high-quality photos, illustrations, videos and music used by individuals, businesses, marketing agencies and media organizations of all sizes. In this role, you will be working with highly motivated and extremely talented data scientists on large datasets, you will help us discover insights hidden in vast amounts of data and help us make smarter decisions to deliver even better products. Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, AI algorithms, deep learning and machine learning, doing statistical analysis and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our products and solutions. Along the way you will be collaborating with an extremely talented and passionate team of researchers, data scientists and engineers from around the world working for Shutterstock. We believe strongly in team ownership of systems, which includes defining the vision of the services to prioritization of projects.
You will join a diverse and international team in our Dublin offices, which are located just off Grafton Street in the heart of the city.
Responsibilities:
Build end-to-end solutions to efficiently develop data projects on large scale data like images, videos, music, customer interactions, and marketing
Enhancing data collection procedures to integrates multiple sources, or types of data, for building innovative data science projects
Investigate new techniques to verify the integrity and the quality of data used in modelling phase and in production along with statistically validating the results against biases and errors
Selecting features, building and optimizing machine learning and statistical models
Analyze data from across Shutterstock including behavioral data to build new recommendation systems, to create automated anomaly detection systems and to predict customers’ interests and intent
Working with data engineers, analysts and business partners to drive ideas from the rapid prototyping phase all the way through to serving and learning from live traffic at scale
Software development with innovative deep learning and machine learning algorithm
Requirements:
3+ years of experience with common machine learning tools like Scikit-Learn and deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, Keras, Torch/PyTorch.
3+ years of industry experience creating, deploying, and monitoring learning algorithms in production
Notebook experience [Jupyter, Zeppelin, Databricks, etc] to perform data analysis and algorithm development using Python
Excellent applied statistics skills, such as distributions, regression, hypothesis testing, A/B testing and experimental design
Fluent coding in one or more programming and query languages including but not limited to Python, C, Java, and SQL
BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Bonus Skills:
Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase
Cloud computing experience
Docker or Kubernetes exposure
Computer Vision experience and natural language processing,
Ph.D. in a related scientific field: Computer science, Physics, Math
Shutterstock Principles
We are one team collectively focused on creating an unrivaled experience for our Customers and Contributors. Our principles represent the mindset of the employee who will thrive at Shutterstock. If you are passionate about what you do, and want to become part of a cutting-edge technology company building industry leading products, please apply. The Opportunity:

At Deloitte, we deliver the solutions and insights our clients need to address their most complex business challenges. As the world’s largest global professional services and consulting network, Deloitte Ireland has nearly 3,000 people providing audit, tax, consulting, and corporate finance services to public and private clients spanning multiple industries.
Deloitte is the leading provider of Risk Advisory services and offers the opportunity to be involved with a wide array of high profile projects across all sectors including Financial Services, Insurance, Banking & Funds, Consumer & Technology Business, and Government, Public and non-State organisations.
At Deloitte, we trust our people to make the right choices around how, where and when they work. Our empowered hybrid way of working allows you to be collaborative, learn from colleagues, share your experiences, build the relationships that will fuel your career and work on individual projects in a way that works for you and our clients. Deloitte Works is built on trust and allows our people to have flexibility and control in how they work. If you apply for a role, please speak to your recruiter or hiring manager to discuss hybrid working and how it could work for you. Read more about Deloitte Works here.
Deloitte will ensure any reasonable accommodations are implemented as part of the recruitment and selection process.
Deloitte is an equal opportunities employer.
.
What impact will you make?
Deloitte is the leading provider of risk services and therefore offers a wide array of high-profile projects and with clients that are leaders in their industry. Deloitte Risk Advisory offers a wide array of services designed to understand IT and business risks, determine acceptable exposure levels, implement controls, and provide follow-up and constant monitoring in the risk and regulatory environment.
About the team
The data analytics team within Deloitte’s Risk Advisory service line is a composite of data driven enthusiasts, who are passionate about helping our clients explore and discover hidden insights within their data to provide real value and support for both operational efficiency and regulatory compliance. We help to take the guesswork out of managing risk-related issues by using a range of technological techniques including advanced analytics to deliver viable outcomes to our client’ needs.
Our team build tools, create interactive visualisations, search for patterns and develop predictive models in order to bring actionable insight from the data. Complementing these abilities with deep industry knowledge across the Deloitte network along with technical integration skills and business transformation capabilities provides a complete offering to our clients, allowing value to be realised from data driven insights. As businesses realise the potential value of their data, analytics specialists with skills in data management, visualisation and insight generation will be in high demand.
The Opportunity
As a member of the Data Analytics team, you will assist with applying data analytic techniques to increase an organisation’s capacity to anticipate risk and maximise business opportunities through data driven insights. Deloitte’s deep and thorough understanding of underlying risk and control issues, combined with our knowledge of technology and analytic skills, uniquely helps us to identify high priority risk areas in our client’s businesses and explore those risks using data analytics.
Successful candidates will have demonstrated their ability to carry out data analysis from initial requirements gathering through to production deployment and operations. They would have communicated a deep interest in solving analytics challenges using many different techniques and technologies and have demonstrated their ongoing commitment to personal learning and development in this discipline. Excellent communication skills with demonstrated ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to a wide audience is a must.
Expertise in data transformation and modelling analytic results, you’ll formulate conclusions and recommendations to client stakeholders, leveraging strong consulting, communication, visualization including storytelling skills.
Work in an agile, collaborative environment, partnering with other stakeholders including audit team and data analytics consultants to integrate the analytics with enterprise-level solution development with the aim of providing viable insights to clients.
Responsible for managing, building and optimizing data architectures and Convert into relevant insights using data analytics technologies and clear interpretations using data governance and data quality processes.
Design of data pipelines for data ingestion and data transformation and ensure the reconciliation and accuracy of the data
Development of data modelling and architecture documentation
Provide technical trainings on data analytics standards and procedures including mentorship to junior colleagues.
Communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders to understand and define business needs and translate them to a data science context
Contribute to the design and development of analytical solutions in response to these risks.
A passion for continuously improving yourself and how we best solve our clients’ problems
Interact cohesively with other members of the Financial Risk & Regulatory team, including being a buddy to new members of the team.
Open and honest communication to understand what is required of you and how you and others can improve.
Contribute to the analysis and interpretation of data towards relevant communications to explain the value of the work completed.
Assist in identifying and collecting data from financial systems and other related data sources
Assist in assessing and determining the techniques and tools to be used in collection, analysis and communication for a project
Apply selected analytical techniques and tools to achieve project outcomes
Ability to effectively work in technical cross-functional teams
Provide expertise on data analytics and digital transformation
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining project timelines
Understanding of ML and AI concepts and its applicability.
SAP experience an advantage.
Project management skills essential for this role.
Practical data engineering skillset is a basic requirement but fundamental domain experience in any field is a complimentary advantage.
About You
You are someone with:
2+ years expert knowledge of advanced SQL/ PostgreSQL
Strong coding skills (Python, Pyspark or any other additional programming language as Java, C++ considered a plus)
Experience extracting and analysing data from complex data sets and systems
Strong attention to detail with a curiosity to understand data
Ability to thrive working in a team environment and serving clients with distinction
Ability to turn data into insights and communicate insights effectively with our clients
Ideally, experience in visual communication of analysis (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, Power BI)
Strong Knowledge of Excel and VBA
Additional Skills required for this role.Communication skills. You are able to confidently communicate in both technical and non-technical teams as well as facilitate discussions within a different team, with potentially difficult dynamics.Data analysis and synthesis. You understand data cleansing and transformation using SSIS, design build and test data products that are complex or large-scale.Data integration design. You know how to select and implement the appropriate technologies to deliver resilient, scalable and future-proofed data solutions.Data modelling. You understand the concepts and principles of data modelling and can produce relevant data models across multiple subject areas. You can compare and align different data models.Problem solving. You know how to respond to problems in databases, data processes, client’s data and services as they occur. You can initiate actions, monitor services and identify trends to resolve problems. You can determine the appropriate remedy and assist with implementation of it as well as preventative measures.Programming and build. You know how to use agreed standards and tools to design, code, test, correct and document moderate-to-complex programs and scripts from agreed specifications and subsequent iterations. At Deloitte, we trust our people to make the right choices around how, where and when they work. .
What impact will you make?
Deloitte is the leading provider of risk services and therefore offers a wide array of high-profile projects and with clients that are leaders in their industry. Deloitte Risk Advisory offers a wide array of services designed to understand IT and business risks, determine acceptable exposure levels, implement controls, and provide follow-up and constant monitoring in the risk and regulatory environment.
About the team
The data analytics team within Deloitte’s Risk Advisory service line is a composite of data driven enthusiasts, who are passionate about helping our clients explore and discover hidden insights within their data to provide real value and support for both operational efficiency and regulatory compliance. We help to take the guesswork out of managing risk-related issues by using a range of technological techniques including advanced analytics to deliver viable outcomes to our client’ needs.
Our team build tools, create interactive visualisations, search for patterns and develop predictive models in order to bring actionable insight from the data. Complementing these abilities with deep industry knowledge across the Deloitte network along with technical integration skills and business transformation capabilities provides a complete offering to our clients, allowing value to be realised from data driven insights. As businesses realise the potential value of their data, analytics specialists with skills in data management, visualisation and insight generation will be in high demand.
The Opportunity
As a member of the Data Analytics team, you will assist with applying data analytic techniques to increase an organisation’s capacity to anticipate risk and maximise business opportunities through data driven insights. Deloitte’s deep and thorough understanding of underlying risk and control issues, combined with our knowledge of technology and analytic skills, uniquely helps us to identify high priority risk areas in our client’s businesses and explore those risks using data analytics.
Successful candidates will have demonstrated their ability to carry out data analysis from initial requirements gathering through to production deployment and operations. They would have communicated a deep interest in solving analytics challenges using many different techniques and technologies and have demonstrated their ongoing commitment to personal learning and development in this discipline. Excellent communication skills with demonstrated ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to a wide audience is a must.
Expertise in data transformation and modelling analytic results, you’ll formulate conclusions and recommendations to client stakeholders, leveraging strong consulting, communication, visualization including storytelling skills.
Work in an agile, collaborative environment, partnering with other stakeholders including audit team and data analytics consultants to integrate the analytics with enterprise-level solution development with the aim of providing viable insights to clients.
Responsible for managing, building and optimizing data architectures and Convert into relevant insights using data analytics technologies and clear interpretations using data governance and data quality processes.
Design of data pipelines for data ingestion and data transformation and ensure the reconciliation and accuracy of the data
Development of data modelling and architecture documentation
Provide technical trainings on data analytics standards and procedures including mentorship to junior colleagues.
Communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders to understand and define business needs and translate them to a data science context
Contribute to the design and development of analytical solutions in response to these risks.
A passion for continuously improving yourself and how we best solve our clients’ problems
Interact cohesively with other members of the Financial Risk & Regulatory team, including being a buddy to new members of the team.
Open and honest communication to understand what is required of you and how you and others can improve.
Contribute to the analysis and interpretation of data towards relevant communications to explain the value of the work completed.
Assist in identifying and collecting data from financial systems and other related data sources
Assist in assessing and determining the techniques and tools to be used in collection, analysis and communication for a project
Apply selected analytical techniques and tools to achieve project outcomes
Ability to effectively work in technical cross-functional teams
Provide expertise on data analytics and digital transformation
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining project timelines
Understanding of ML and AI concepts and its applicability.
SAP experience an advantage.
Project management skills essential for this role.
Practical data engineering skillset is a basic requirement but fundamental domain experience in any field is a complimentary advantage.
About You
You are someone with:
2+ years expert knowledge of advanced SQL/ PostgreSQL
Strong coding skills (Python, Pyspark or any other additional programming language as Java, C++ considered a plus)
Experience extracting and analysing data from complex data sets and systems
Strong attention to detail with a curiosity to understand data
Ability to thrive working in a team environment and serving clients with distinction
Ability to turn data into insights and communicate insights effectively with our clients
Ideally, experience in visual communication of analysis (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, Power BI)
Strong Knowledge of Excel and VBA

You are able to confidently communicate in both technical and non-technical teams as well as facilitate discussions within a different team, with potentially difficult dynamics.Data analysis and synthesis. You understand data cleansing and transformation using SSIS, design build and test data products that are complex or large-scale.Data integration design. You know how to select and implement the appropriate technologies to deliver resilient, scalable and future-proofed data solutions.Data modelling. You know how to respond to problems in databases, data processes, client’s data and services as they occur. You can initiate actions, monitor services and identify trends to resolve problems. You know how to use agreed standards and tools to design, code, test, correct and document moderate-to-complex programs and scripts from agreed specifications and subsequent iterations. You can collaborate with others to review specifications where appropriate.Technical understanding. You understand core technical concepts related to the role and can apply them with guidance.

The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can’t imagine living without.
Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.
We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?
The Challenge

The Customer Success Team is at the heart of Qualtrics. From the initial onboarding to ongoing adoption, we assist customers throughout their lifecycle, helping them unlock the most value from our products and services. We understand their goals and, as trusted advisors, recommend solutions to the challenges they face. We are looking for scrappy individuals to join our team to have a huge impact on customer retention and expansion. We have impressive members on this team, and are always looking for more amazing talent!

Ultimately you will work closely with Customer Success Representatives to ensure our customers are lifetime Qualtrics champions. If you are a superb communicator and data scientist, have the ability to build positive relationships, and want to work at a fast-growing tech company, Qualtrics could be the place you’ve been dreaming about.

Expectations for Success

In this client-facing principal data science role, you will primarily be an enabler of Expansion and Renewal for the front line Customer Success Teams, supporting them through expertise in data science. You will be part of the growing Qualtrics Subject Matter Expert community that helps some of the world’s top minds turn insights into action. Whether you’re speaking with the Head of CX, a data science director or a chief marketing officer, you'll constantly be challenged to come up with new and creative solutions to our clients’ research needs.

Bring your analytical mind, problem-solving skills, and deep expertise in statistics and machine learning to turn data into insights and action our clients can take to improve their customer experience and business. If you love solving problems with statistical theory, hands on coding, hacking, partnering with clients and thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, this position is for you!

Qualifications & Requirements: Basic (must haves)


Technical Skills/Knowledge

Graduate degree in a technical field (statistics, data science, analytics, mathematics, engineering, etc.)
Demonstrated knowledge of the both the theory and practice of data science (with strength in explanatory/inferential statistics)
5+ years hands on coding experience in 1 or more of R [Qualtrics iQ Suite is a nice to have, particularly Stats iQ]
5+ years experience wrangling Big Data focused on customer-centric business questions
Ability to identify best analytical approaches to solve client business problems
Understanding business perspectives and distilling project goals into attainable pieces

Softer Experience and Skills

8+ years of prior customer facing data science experience
Ability to build strong relationships with client account (CS) reps, clients and across the wider organization, with a passion for sharing success stories
Demonstrated history of working successfully with external/internal clients as evidenced by strong DS project work and impact
Can communicate complex concepts in a clear, concise and compelling manner
Storytelling with data: designing and communicating results to clients in easily digestible formats
Fluent in English

Preferred (nice to haves)

High energy, self-starter comfortable with ambiguity in entrepreneurial environments. TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, Mountain View, New York, Austin, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, São Paulo, Seoul and Tokyo

--About our Team--
The global Monetization Product team enables our Integrity operations teams to provide safe and quality experiences between users, creators, and businesses to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok users and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats.

The team is composed of Policy, Operations, Product, and Service specialists working cross-functionally with key stakeholders (Product, Engineering, Data Science, PR, Legal, and Sales) to design and optimize ad policies, manage moderation processes, and build scalable systems to drive efficiencies within our integrity mechanisms. This team plays a critical role in cross-functional work solving large-scale issues that have a significant global impact on our business and TikTokers.

TikTok's advertising and other monetization channels are growing at an explosive pace. The Monetization Product Data Science team sits at the epicenter of newly created features for both creators and advertisers as well as staying closely aligned with the integrity challenges that face our growing business. This team enables our operations teams to plan and allocate resources across our global teams, we conduct deep analysis into emerging trends to make data-informed business decisions, and we build measurement systems to track performance and determine success for prototypes and experimental processes. Our team drives value through our quantitative expertise mixed with a deep understanding of human behavior, industry trends, and entrepreneurial initiative. Our team must ruthlessly prioritize with data-informed decisions to continue to enable the exponential growth of our business.

--Some of the things you'll do--

Design, implement, and measure results of experiments linked to the performance of new tools and systems
Design, implement, and manage robust measurement systems to ensure optimal system performance and monitor trends
Develop in-depth expertise in the area of risk prevention and product revenue growth using quantitative methods
Be a thought leader on how to elevate existing processes to greater efficiency & automation
Conduct root cause analysis on data discrepancy issues to identify resolution path
Communicate key technical insights and opportunities to the diverse cross-functional audience in easy to understand terms
Coordinate with our internal global partners and peers to influence strategy and priorities and ensure best practices are being followed
Build and manage relationships across a professionally and culturally diverse team of partners and stakeholders

--Our ideal background--

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field like Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or equivalent education/work experience
Extensive experience solving quantitative problems in a production environment
The ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Fluency in SQL (Hive) for analyses, data manipulation
Experience with BI visualization platforms (Tableau, Shiny, Power BI, Looker)
Comfortable designing and running complex experiments (A/B or Bayesian testing) to measure new products and features' success
Data engineering experience is a plus (modeling, monitoring, debugging)
Advanced knowledge of machine learning techniques and tools (Python/pySpark, time-series, classification, clustering, regression problems) is a plus
Experience in building or integrating production-ready analytical/machine learning pipelines (Airflow, dbt, ClickHouse) is a plus
Experience working with digital advertising data and products, integrity space is a plus

-- How You Will Progress --
Your development is as important to us, as it is to you. You’ll be rewarded for hard work here, with support to get better at what you do. We work in a fast-paced project environment where change is constant. If you’re up for the challenge, you’ll have opportunities to try new things and broaden your skills quickly through exposure to the executive team and new experiences.

We are looking for creative, bold people who embrace ownership and are driven to make a positive impact on the world. If you're excited to collaborate with diverse global teams and lead fast-paced initiatives that make a difference from day one, work with us and challenge yourself to move the world!

Apply now to start your journey to Inspire creativity, enrich life.

-- Equal Opportunities --
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals should not be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

As a truly diverse company, TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. job_title: Data Scientist, Networking, Network Availability Engineering
listing_jobDesc:
3+ years working experience as a Data Scientist or related positions.
3+ years of experience using a scripting language such as Python and data manipulation/analysis libraries such as Scikit-learn and Pandas for analyzing and modeling data.
Proficient with data querying languages (e.g. SQL, Scala), statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, Matlab)
Proven ability to communicate verbally and in writing to technical peers and leadership teams with various levels of technical knowledge, educating them about our systems, as well as sharing insights and data-driven recommendations.
Experience creating visualizations to drive data insight

Job summary
Data Scientist, Network Automation and Cost is an exciting new role in the Network Availability Engineering team. You will work with software engineers, development managers, finance and senior leaders to provide insight into the cost of operating our services as we work to reduce customer impact and eliminate manual work processes.

Amazon’s network is a key differentiator for our global businesses and our customers. Network Availability Engineering is a global engineering and science organization within Network Services. Our goal is to give Amazon’s network engineers the tools they need to provide customers with an experience that is indistinguishable from perfect.

In 2022, we're taking a goal to significantly reduce the cost of running our services while further expanding the tooling we provide to network operators. We need your help to deliver insight into cost across the org and develop cost models that highlight opportunities while we continue to work to better serve our customers.

The Data Scientist for this goal will be responsible for delivering insight into the costs of our services across the org, helping managers model future costs and surfacing cost opportunities. You’ll communicate with leadership frequently, leverage visualizations to help business leaders understand our costs and surface insight to drive strategic decisions.

Key job responsibilities
Great candidates will have a track record of driving their own work and delivering results. Crisp, informative, and effective written and verbal communication skills are a key requirement. You will be able to communicate the output of your analysis to technical and non-technical stakeholders at a range of levels.

Key job responsibilities

Establishing scalable, efficient, automated processes for data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation
Delivering insight verbally and through thoughtful, focussed data visualizations.
Tracking costs across the org and providing clear, compelling management reporting on a regular basis
Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Business Analytics, Economics, Finance, Engineering, or Computer Science, or a related quantitative field or equivalent experience.
Very strong business acumen and product sense
Experience working directly with engineers and with management at various levels.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need an adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please contact the Applicant-Candidate Accommodation Team (ACAT), Monday through Friday from 7:00 am GMT - 4:00 pm GMT. If calling directly from the United Kingdom, please dial +44 800 086 9884 (tel: +448000869884). If calling from Ireland, please dial +353 1800 851 489 (tel: +3531800851489).
