job_title: Director, Data Science | Corporate Finance & Restructuring
listing_jobDesc:
Data Scientist- Director, Digital Science| Corporate Finance & Restructuring


About the Role:


We are expanding our Data Science team within FTI's Corporate Finance & Restructuring practice, addressing the growing data and analytics needs of both internal and external clients. Whether it be analysis and predictive models to facilitate growth initiatives / cost reduction or using a more granular data driven forecast approach, there is a desire to use data more intelligently to increase business benefits.
As a consultancy firm, we look to drive improved business performance; as a data science team, we look for interesting and advanced ways to do this. Our data scientists employ advanced mathematics, statistics, and computer science (ML and algorithmic), together with industry knowledge to tackle business problem for our clients. The team is technologically agnostic and has experience across a number of different tools.
If you are someone who is interesting in applying technical solutions to practical business problems as well as leading projects with technical, talented people and a wide range of business professionals then we would love to meet you. You should have a pragmatic approach to problem-solving and be capable of developing solutions that clients can rely on in production.

What you'll do:

Participate in varied data and analytics projects, from deep dive analysis and reporting to full model build, implementation and maintenance.Lead sections of a project; including managing a small team of data specialists, leading client engagements and managing project delivery.
• Participate in and shape business analysis activities to gather required requirements and inform data science and analytics solution design. • Undertake data discovery, exploratory data analysis and feature engineering.
• Apply machine learning and simulation techniques to provide insight for our clients; e.g. Logistic Regression, Random Forest, Neural Networks, etc. • Develop and test data pipelines working alongside data engineering specialists.
Work with client business leadership to ensure the commercial value from the analytics is realised.Partake in and shape analytics R&D work.Support business development activities and meet directly with clients.Mentor junior team members, provide coaching and support them in developing their careers.

How you'll grow:

As an employee, you can expect job satisfaction and intellectual challenges while working as part of a growing and developing team servicing clients across various sectors and industries.
As a business, we will invest in training and will support your development to ensure continuous enhancement of your skills and advancement in your career path, in addition to flexible mentorship across any part of FTI. Offering you a challenging but empowered environment to work in and accessibility to exceptional network in Fortune 500

Required:

Minimum 2.1 degree in Analytics, Data Mining, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or a related technical discipline.5 years' previous development experience in Data Science/BI/Project environments.Experience in SQL, Python, R, Scala, Tensorflow, PySpark or equivalent data science technologies.Previous experience in a consultancy or similar client facing environment.Advanced knowledge of Excel.Excellent consultative, communication, presentation and management skills.Entitlement to work in Ireland and the UK.

Desired:

Highly motivated, with a proven ability to work both separately and as part of a team with professionals at all levels and of various disciplines.Passionate about client service excellence.Experience in DevOps.Knowledge of MLs framework e.g. Torch, TensorFlow.Experience with cloud technologies i.e. AWS/Azure.Industry experience in Insurance, Banking, Financial Services, Software or Telecommunications.

Our Benefits

Apart from the well-structured career path and excellent team environment, our employees enjoy a variety of perks and benefits. We offer competitive benefits and wellbeing programme including private medical insurance, dental insurance, life insurance, income protection, flex critical illness cover, 5% employer pension contribution, holiday buy, paid volunteer hours and corporate matching for charitable donations, and much more.

About FTI Consulting What makes us unique? With more than 5,000 employees located in offices in every corner of the globe, we are the firm our clients call when their most important issues are at stake. Regardless of what level you are, you will have the opportunity to work alongside and learn from top experts in your field on high-profile engagements that impact history. Our culture is collaborative, and we value diversity, recognition, development and making a difference in our communities.
FTI Consulting is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange and has been recognized as a Best Firm to Work For by Consulting magazine and one of America's Best Management Consulting Firms by Forbes. For more information, visit www.fticonsulting.com and connect with us on Twitter (@FTI Consulting), Facebook and LinkedIn. FTI Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, protected veteran status, religion, physical or mental disability, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or e

Apart from the well-structured career path and excellent team environment, our employees enjoy a variety of perks and benefits. Our benefits include, but are not limited to:

Competitive salary and bonus plans
Generous paid holidays and paid time off
Annual paid volunteer hours
Corporate matching for charitable donations
Free snacks and drinks

The Opportunity:
As an AI Engineer, you will play a key role in designing and driving our data integration pipelines, ETL/ELT, and analytic strategies across our enterprise. In this role you will be bringing modern data technologies and practices to enable our talented team of data scientists to build, train, and deploy ML models. You will partner with all data teams at Shutterstock to understand requirements and collaborate on providing solutions at scale.
Responsibilities:
Determine optimal solutions for integrating data from a variety of sources
Implement, maintain and monitor batch & stream data pipelines with best practice quality controls
Evaluate relevant new and mature technologies as needs, gaps, and opportunities arise
Work closely and collaboratively in an Agile environment with our analysts, engineers and product teams to analyze issues and find new insights covering our business and operations
Collaborate with our other data teams, as they are customers
Ability to identify problem patterns and apply solutions that enable our team to accelerate delivery
Requirements:
Proficiency [4+ years] in Python and Java or Scala.
Experience in stream processing technology (Kafka, Kinesis, Spark, Storm, Samza, Flink, etc)
Knowledge of SQL, data modeling and dimensional modeling concepts
Distributed and low latency (streaming) application architecture
Familiarity with API design
CI/CD systems experience (Jenkins, Github, etc)
Experience adhering to robust audit standards
AWS experience
BS or MS degree in Computer Science or Engineering related experience
Bonus Skills:
Knowledge of emerging data integration technologies
Spark Streaming, Kafka Streams, Kafka Connect, etc
Exposure to Kubernetes and Helm
Data Science and model deployment pipeline experience
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as H2O, scikit-learn or similar tools
Strong expertise/background with Linux
Shutterstock Principles
We are one team collectively focused on creating an unrivaled experience for our Customers and Contributors. Our principles represent the mindset of the employee who will thrive at Shutterstock. If you are passionate about what you do, and want to become part of a cutting-edge technology company building industry leading products, please apply. The Opportunity:

Job Description
FSM's Equipment Productivity Group is hiring a Senior Data Science Engineer to focus on Module Data Solutions. With Intel's ambitious IDM2.0 manufacturing goals, the focus on equipment performance, machine productivity, and labor efficiency has never been more critical to the future success of the company.
The Data Science Engineer will focus on the following objectives to drive module performance to new heights helping achieve best in world fab productivity in our current FSM and future foundry factories:
Use predictive modeling, statistics, Machine Learning, Data Mining, and other data analysis techniques to collect, explore, and extract insights from structure and unstructured data.
Identify 'grass roots' module productivity solutions and expand across Intel's fab network
Develop software, algorithms and applications to expand fab support systems (APC, machine learning, predictive and prescriptive analytics)
Centralize and standardize module engineering data support systems to support new fabs
Partner with Internal stakeholders to drive Intel's 2yr, 5yr, and 10yr vision for module sustaining
Drive strategies to insert leading-edge data systems/solutions on older technologies
Partner with suppliers to develop and implement advanced data solutions that will help Intel
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline such as Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, Industrial Engineering, Physics, or Chemistry
5+ years in 300mm fab process or equipment engineering experience
2+ years in data analytics and relational databases (Python, SQL, dashboards, APC, machine learning, etc)
Preferred Qualifications:
MS or PhD in a technical discipline such as Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, Industrial Engineering, Physics, or Chemistry
7+ years process and equipment development, or sustaining factory experience
3+ years in data analytics and relational databases (Python, SQL, dashboards, APC, machine learning, etc)
The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:
Passionate about improving Intel's module and fab productivity
Strong advocate for inclusion, teamwork, and driving collaboration across business units
Proven strong engineering capabilities
Experience operating in complex and ambiguous environments
Ability to drive results through a global team
Ability to communicate and present data clearly and effectively
Lifelong learner and someone who challenges status quo
Enjoys and excels in a creative and entrepreneurial environment
Willingness to remove barriers
At Intel inclusion means we recognize and respect the worth and dignity of every employee. We promote and sustain a sense of belonging, valuing diverse talents, beliefs, backgrounds, and experiences to help Intel win. Our success depends on Intel’s amazing employees. Make Intel your workplace of choice today. Intel provides equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees in all areas of employment.
Intel does not discriminate based on race, characteristics that are commonly or historically associated with race including hair, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.
Inside this Business Group
As the world's largest chip manufacturer, Intel strives to make every facet of semiconductor manufacturing state-of-the-art - from semiconductor process development and manufacturing, through yield improvement to packaging, final test and optimization, and world class Supply Chain and facilities support. Employees in the Technology Development and Manufacturing Group are part of a worldwide network of design, development, manufacturing, and assembly/test facilities, all focused on utilizing the power of Moore’s Law to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth.
Other Locations

Israel, Kiryat-Gat
Work Model for this Role

This role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. Job Description

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok.

Our Trust & Safety team's commitment is to keep our online community safe. We have invested heavily in human and machine-based moderation to remove harmful content quickly and often before it reaches our general community.

As a member of the Data Science team, you will work with diverse and highly collaborative teams of product managers, engineers, and other data analysts to drive product impact. You will have the opportunity to define metrics and identify opportunities from one of the richest data sets in the world, and convert the insights into real changes, for both new initiatives and scaled products. You are a self starter who is excited about data, excels in product logic thinking, clear communication, and brings distinctive problem solving skills and impeccable business judgment.

As a Data Science Manager, you will know how to connect the dots and interact with people in various functions, identify T&S challenges, propose solutions, and drive sustainable product impact. The ideal candidate will have a background in Data Science and T&S leadership, strong technical skills and expertise working with loosely defined tasks.

About This Role:
We are looking for a leader, who has strong analytical skills and is able both to lead others and deal with analytical tasks to solve complex and loosely defined problems, communicate with stakeholders and provide support to the team. The ideal candidate will have strong SQL knowledge, leadership, communication and collaboration skills, be a self-starter, oriented on results, able to ask the right questions and get answers, understand the business needs and processes.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead a team of at least 10 data scientists, including 2 Data Science managers: define goals, provide guidance and feedback, support career growth
Understand problem space, product and related business processes, build a vision on how to improve such processes
Partner with XFN teams, including Policy, Ops, Algo, Product Strategy and Engineering and other to solve Trust & Safety challenges
Apply your expertise in analysis, data mining, visualization to provide business insights and recommendations on product/processes improvements
Conduct research and analysis on various business processes to identify business problems, and further provide optimisation suggestions to improve operating efficiency.

Key Requirements:

At least 5 years experience in data science, business or product analytics. Trust & Safety experience is a plus
Minimum 3 years experience in leading data science or analytics teams in a formal or informal capacity

Demonstrated leadership and self-direction. Willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques

Ability to conduct rigorous analysis and communicate conclusions to both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience in business analysis, and/or product analysis teams in a cross-cultural and cross-functional environment
Proven ability to succeed in an innovative and fast-paced environment
Solid communication and collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively with internal
Proficiency in SQL. Python skills are a plus
Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in data analytics related fields.
Your ability to work in a high tempo environment, adapt, respond to day-to-day challenges of the role.
Your resilience and commitment to self-care to manage the emotional demands of the role.

Trust & Safety recognises that keeping our platform safe for TikTok communities is no ordinary job which can be both rewarding and psychologically demanding and emotionally taxing for some. This is why we are sharing the potential hazards, risks and implications in this unique line of work from the start, so our candidates are well informed before joining.

We are committed to the wellbeing of all our employees and promise to provide comprehensive and evidence-based programs, to promote and support physical and mental wellbeing throughout each employee's journey with us. We believe that wellbeing is a relationship and that everyone has a part to play, so we work in collaboration and consultation with our employees and across our functions in order to ensure a truly person-centred, innovative and integrated approach.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too. TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

job_title: VP - Software Engineering and Data Science- Hybrid
listing_jobDesc:
Optum, the fastest growing part of UnitedHealth Group, is a leading information and technology-enabled health services business. Our teams are dedicated to modernising the health care system and improving the lives of people and communities.
Serving virtually every dimension of the health system, we work with a diverse set of clients across 150 countries – from those who diagnose and treat patients to those who pay for care, deliver health services, and those who supply the cures. Optum maintains operations across North America, South America, Europe, Asia Pacific and the Middle East. Our innovative partnerships provide technology and tools that enable unprecedented collaboration and efficiency. As a result, we can tap into valuable health care data to uncover insights and develop strategies for better care at lower costs.
About the role:
As a direct report of the Chief Data Scientist of Optum Enterprise Data and Analytics, you will be accountable for providing visionary Technology directions across our enterprise and market. You will be a senior technology leader with focus on future technology needs of the organization. You will lead a portfolio of methodologies on technology research and development projects. You will leverage your technology expertise and understanding of market trends, to formulate, develop and execute multi-year strategic technology plans to grow the business and deliver real value to our customers. You will have the partnership opportunities to get those incubated solutions into the right teams to continue the development post R&D. Portfolios include several AI/ML and other Technologies.
We have teams with deep expertise which include NLP, GNN, Graph Databases, Python, MLOps, UX Design, and even Full Stack Engineering, and oversee and incubate new technologies. With demonstrated expertise in our portfolio, there are many places to grow.
Careers with Optum offer flexible work arrangements and individuals who live and work in the Republic of Ireland will have the opportunity to split their monthly work hours between our Dublin office and telecommuting from a home-based office.
Primary Responsibilities
Collaborating with CIOs and business leaders to provide long-term thinking, strategy, and understanding of future product and services
Regular forward-thinking knowledge sharing on cutting edge technologies (internally and externally). Global forums, conferences, and knowledge building modalities.
Cultivating an established network of industry expertise, and leveraging that group
Partnering with Product and Leaders to provide strategic oversight, analytics, and leadership.
Contribute to Optum Tech strategy and UGH strategy about innovative technology thinking.
Keep UHG on the leading edge of technology

Leading the Ireland Technology team and collaborating with the global technology teams within ATC, Optum, and peer organizations
Required Qualifications:
Demonstrated recognition for innovative work in a variety of technologies
Cloud, Analytics, Data Science, AI & Machine Learning expertise
Professional and Technology Affiliations
Demonstrated experience in the following:
Leading technology direction
Influencing business strategy
Communicating with executive leadership
Championing changeAbility to inspire Distinguished Engineers and guide innovative
Preferred Qualifications:
Patents and publications
Careers with Optum . Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.SM
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law Optum, the fastest growing part of UnitedHealth Group, is a leading information and technology-enabled health services business. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.SM
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law Show more

Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Mastercard is a global technology company. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making payment and data transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.

Overview
ML Engineering team leads AI/ML deployments across Mastercard platforms. The team is responsible for planning the implementation of solutions, choosing the right technologies, and evaluating the evolution of the architecture as the needs change.
For this team, MasterCard is seeking a Lead Engineer who is passionate about implementation of AI/ML assets across platform (on premise, on cloud, hybrid). The person would be working closely with Program Team as well as Data Science team.

Responsibilities -
Responsible for modern architecture-based deployment for AI/Machine Learning solutions, products.Providing service to other engineering teams across organization, cross functions for deliver quality architecture for AI/ML model deployments or serving.Define deployment strategy and infrastructure for models and be responsible for ensuring model development is deployable at scale.
Experiences
5+ years of experience working in AI/ML technology domain or similar.Experience in building and deploying AI/ML models in enterprise production environments/large scale projects with modern light weight design (API, Microservices etc.)Good knowledge of Machine learning —bias-variance trade off, exploration/exploitation—and understanding of various model families, including neural net, decision trees, Bayesian models, deep learning algorithms(LSTM, CNN etc.)Experience with ML frameworks and libraries like TensorFlow, Keras, Pytorch, KubeflowAbility to learn new technologies quickly and mentor Data Science team members in AI/ML domain.Proven track record of delivering and willingness to roll up sleeves to get the job done.Current with industry trends on On-premise or Cloud native deploymentsExcellent communication/presentation skills
COVID-19 Considerations
We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together. In many locations, which may change over time, we’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in some locations, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated will be permitted inside Mastercard offices until further notice.
In the US, Mastercard is a government contractor, which may legally require most Mastercard employees to be vaccinated unless a verified approved medical or religious exemption is granted. Further, we are currently making every effort towards having employees return to work in the office 2 days per week, if that makes sense for their team. Everyone must be vaccinated to enter Mastercard offices at this time. Therefore, we expect all candidates to be vaccinated or to be approved for a medical or religious accommodation prior to commencing work at Mastercard.
Corporate Security Responsibility
All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines. Our Purpose

Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
At TTEC, we're all about the Human Experience. Elevated. As a Data Analyst in Dublin, you'll be a part of creating and delivering amazing candidate experiences while you also #ExperienceTTEC, an award-winning employment experience and company culture.
What You'll be Doing
Looking for an opportunity where your analysis impacts the business? Curious about uncovering patterns in your research and analyzing the data to inform strategic In this role, gather, prepare, and analyze data for client sales and marketing programs. You'll directly collect, validate, cleanse, and load data from internal or external systems into databases to enable successful user adoption of analytics tools and reports. You'll work with strategic marketing managers and other program support resources to provide analysis, creative feedback, and prepare findings for presentation to management.
You'll report to the Operations Manager. In this role, you'll impact the business through your research and analysis initiatives.
During a Typical Day, You'll
Run and extract reports/data from internal and external systems or sources
Perform checks to ensure data integrity and consistency
Run manual and automated processes (such as scripts, SQL stored procedures, loaders, PowerPivot refreshes, VB, etc. ) to streamline cleansing and loading of data
Create and fine tune queries necessary for performing voice/text analysis using speech analytics platforms
Analyze qualitative & quantitative data, identify trends and improvement opportunities
Conduct root cause analysis to determine underlying drivers behind performance gaps
Provide data mining, root cause and trend analysis, deep dives, and data manipulation to effectively assess and communicate operational situations and strategies
What You Bring to the Role
Bachelor's degree
1+ years data science, business intelligence, or high-growth analytics experience
Strong skills for data analysis and interpretation in Excel, PowerBI, PowerPivot, R, Python, SQL, and other tools
Experience with data management - understanding of databases, SQL queries, ETLs, and data models (tabular, cube, etc.)
Knowledge of CRM systems and data visualization/BI tools (such as Salesforce, Tableau), and contact center metrics a plus
Detail and solution oriented and customer focused mindset
Comfortable with building branded presentations including easily digestible summaries with your recommendations or observations - so bring those amazing Excel and PowerPoint skills
What You Can Expect
Dedication to your career growth and professional development
Actively diverse and inclusive culture
Community-minded organization committed to giving back
Global team of curious lifelong learners guided by our company values
And yes... all the competitive compensation, performance bonus opportunities, benefits you'd expect and maybe a few that would pleasantly surprise you
About TTEC
Our business is about making customers happy. That's all we do. Since 1982, we've helped companies build engaged, pleased, profitable customer experiences powered by our combination of humanity and technology. On behalf of many of the world's leading iconic and disruptive brands, we talk, message, text, and video chat with millions of customers every day. These exceptional customer experiences start with you.
TTEC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer where all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. TTEC embraces and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce that respects and empowers the culture and perspectives within our global teams. We strive to reflect the communities we serve by not only delivering amazing service and technology, but also humanity. We make it a point to make sure all our employees feel valued and comfortable being their authentic selves at work. As a global company, we know diversity is our strength. It enables us to view projects and ideas from different vantage points and allows every individual to bring value to the table in their own unique way.

: IE-Leinster-Dublin

Senior Data Scientist
Dublin, Ireland
(Full-Time)

About the Company:
Our client is an independent TV measurement and analytics firm that offers advertising and content measurement, full-funnel attribution, media planning, optimization, and analytical solutions. Comprised of engineers, analysts, data scientists, media experts and marketing strategists, our client forges new paths using ground-breaking innovations that set industry standards for audience targeting and measurement.
The Role:
Our client is looking for a dynamic Senior Data Scientist to serve as a coding and methodological thought leader. Being able and excited to analyse large and messy data is part of the job, as is having the skills to flexibly work on a variety of tasks to maintain project success. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for improving methods and efficiencies across the team, project management, hands-on coding and cross team collaboration.
Responsibilities:
Working independently or collaboratively on large and complex data science problems and analyses
Leading and mentoring fellow analysts and data scientists
Communicating with clients to develop analytical solutions within client context
Applying or adapting methods to new problems, and developing new tools as needed
Collaborating with software engineers to implement methods into production
Working with client/sales team to build new business opportunities.

Requirements:
Master's degree in a quantitative field
7+ years’ experience (or postgraduate degree(s) plus experience) in a comparable field
4+ years of coding and specifically 2+ years in R/Python
Able and excited to analyse large and messy data
Strict integrity, able to work with confidential, private, and high-value client information
Intellectual flexibility to adapt existing tools, algorithms, methods to new needs
Can balance workload across a variety of different projects over the course of a week
Find stable threads to explore within amorphous and changing business problems
Proficiency with statistics and machine learning techniques and the ability to continually improve current methodologies and processes
Solid understanding of sampling, weighting, biased data, overfitting, ensemble methods, survey methodology, causal inference
Strong ability to communicate about data structure and characteristics, analytical techniques, statistical findings, and solutions to a variety of audiences using data visualization and reporting tools such as ggplot2, matplotlib, Shiny, etc.
Excellent written skills to translate results to a variety of technical and non-technical audiences through white papers; reports; and internal, external, and client-facing presentations

Preferred Skills:
PhD, ABD with experience in a comparable field
Experience working in analytics in the entertainment industry or in television or digital marketing
Experience designing and analysing experiments
Experience analysing high-dimensional time series or event stream data
Experience adapting, implementing, and scaling various machine learning techniques
Experience with Databricks (or other distributed computing environments) and familiarity with Spark SQL and Scala

Our client offers a competitive salary and benefits package including medical, dental and vision.
If you are interested in this role, please email adelaine@alldus.com Senior Data Scientist

If you are interested in this role, please email adelaine@alldus.com Senior Data Scientist
Dublin, Ireland
(Full-Time)

About the Company:
Our client is an independent TV measurement and analytics firm that offers advertising and content measurement, full-funnel attribution, media planning, optimization, and analytical solutions. Comprised of engineers, analysts, data scientists, media experts and marketing strategists, our client forges new paths using ground-breaking innovations that set industry standards for audience targeting and measurement.
The Role:
Our client is looking for a dynamic Senior Data Scientist to serve as a coding and methodological thought leader. Being able and excited to analyse large and messy data is part of the job, as is having the skills to flexibly work on a variety of tasks to maintain project success. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for improving methods and efficiencies across the team, project management, hands-on coding and cross team collaboration.
Responsibilities:
Working independently or collaboratively on large and complex data science problems and analyses
Leading and mentoring fellow analysts and data scientists
Communicating with clients to develop analytical solutions within client context
Applying or adapting methods to new problems, and developing new tools as needed
Collaborating with software engineers to implement methods into production
Working with client/sales team to build new business opportunities.

Requirements:
Master's degree in a quantitative field
7+ years’ experience (or postgraduate degree(s) plus experience) in a comparable field
4+ years of coding and specifically 2+ years in R/Python
Able and excited to analyse large and messy data
Strict integrity, able to work with confidential, private, and high-value client information
Intellectual flexibility to adapt existing tools, algorithms, methods to new needs
Can balance workload across a variety of different projects over the course of a week
Find stable threads to explore within amorphous and changing business problems
Proficiency with statistics and machine learning techniques and the ability to continually improve current methodologies and processes
Solid understanding of sampling, weighting, biased data, overfitting, ensemble methods, survey methodology, causal inference
Strong ability to communicate about data structure and characteristics, analytical techniques, statistical findings, and solutions to a variety of audiences using data visualization and reporting tools such as ggplot2, matplotlib, Shiny, etc.
Excellent written skills to translate results to a variety of technical and non-technical audiences through white papers; reports; and internal, external, and client-facing presentations

Preferred Skills:
PhD, ABD with experience in a comparable field
Experience working in analytics in the entertainment industry or in television or digital marketing
Experience designing and analysing experiments
Experience analysing high-dimensional time series or event stream data
Experience adapting, implementing, and scaling various machine learning techniques
Experience with Databricks (or other distributed computing environments) and familiarity with Spark SQL and Scala

Our client offers a competitive salary and benefits package including medical, dental and vision.
If you are interested in this role, please email adelaine@alldus.com Show more

[As of June 2020, Quora has become a "remote-first" company. This position can be performed remotely from anywhere in the world, regardless of any location that might be specified above.]

About Quora:

The vast majority of human knowledge is still not on the internet. Most of it is trapped in the form of experience in people's heads, or buried in books and papers that only experts can access. More than a billion people use the internet, yet only a tiny fraction contribute their knowledge to it. We want to democratize access to knowledge of all kinds — from politics to painting, cooking to coding, etymology to experiences — so if someone out there knows something, anyone else can learn it. Our mission is to share and grow the world's knowledge, and we're building a world-class team to help us achieve this mission.

About the Team:

Our small engineering team works on challenging problems every day. We have a culture that's rooted in constantly learning and improving, and our engineers are encouraged to think big and experiment with new ideas. Using continuous deployment, we quickly see our changes in the product and make fast iterations. Our engineers focus on creating polished products and writing high-quality code by designing APIs and abstractions that are extensible and maintainable. As a remote-first company, our engineers have a high degree of flexibility and autonomy. Everyone on the engineering team has a huge impact on our product and our company.

About the Role:

Since we first launched our advertising platform, we've already grown to support thousands of advertisers who are reaching over 300 million+ monthly unique visitors on Quora. Our journey is just beginning as we continue to build new products from the ground up and tackle exciting challenges at scale. Today, we're working on a broad range of areas to grow our ads product to drive more value to our users and advertisers.


We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning engineer to join our Machine Learning team responsible for Ads ranking, targeting, as well as other monetization strategies. As an engineer on the team, you will have a unique opportunity to have a high impact by advancing these ML models and systems, as well as uncovering new opportunities to apply machine learning to the Quora monetization products.

Responsibilities:
Improve our existing machine learning systems using your core coding skills and ML knowledge
Identify new opportunities to apply machine learning to different parts of the Quora product
Work with other machine learning engineers to implement algorithms and systems in an efficient way
Take end to end ownership of machine learning systems - from data pipelines, feature engineering, candidate extraction, model training, as well as integration into our production systems
Minimum Qualifications:
Ability to be available for meetings and impromptu communication during Quora's "coordination hours" (Mon-Fri: 9am-3pm Pacific Time). Learn why here
3+ years of professional software development experience in machine learning
1+ years of professional experience working on machine learning backed monetization. This can include advertising, subscriptions, etc
Good understanding of mathematical foundations of machine learning algorithms
Previous experience building end to end machine learning systems
BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
5+ years of overall professional machine learning experience with 3+ years of professional machine learning monetization experience.
2+ years of experience writing Python or C++ code
Experience with leading large-scale multi-engineer projects
Flexible and positive team player with outstanding interpersonal skills
Passion for Quora's mission and goals

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) disclosure

Auto req ID: 265006BR
Applications are invited for the permanent position of Data Analytics Manager managing the Data & Analytics IT team based in Carrigaline, Cork. As the Manager of PGCS’s growing Data & Analytics (D&A) practice, this role is required to lead the design and implementation of leading-edge reporting, data & analytics solutions to meet an ever increasing need to maximize the potential of data in realising our business goals. The Data & Analytics Manager will drive and support the PGCS D&A agenda.

We are the concentrate team in PepsiCo (PGCS) working across the Beverage, Nutrition and Snacks categories to deliver concentrate for many of PepsiCo’s mega brands including Gatorade, 7Up and Pepsi. We are at the heart of PepsiCo products, sourcing ingredients to manufacture more than 1,200 recipes for our brands. We are a global organisation, situated in 16 locations across 9 countries offering careers in various functions from Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Procurement, Quality, Finance, R&D, HR and IT. We want team members who can collaborate in our fast paced global organisation and are passionate about creating and delivering much-loved household brands to markets across the world.

The Data & Analytics landscape consists of: SAP MDG, Workflow, Winshuttle, ~15 SAP ECC functional modules and a number of analytics technologies including BW on HANA, Tableau, SAC, Data Science (Python, R), SAP BW, SAP BEX, BEX Analyser, BO WEBI, BO Dashboards, Analysis for Office, SLT, BODS, Fiori across all PGCS sites, Support centre and Sector BU’s.

The Manager has responsibility for managing an investment budget of $250-500M annually, although this may fluctuate from year to year.

This role will report to the IT Enterprise Solutions Director for PGCS and will have a key role in leading out IT delivery of the Data & Analytics agenda. We have an exciting and varied agenda, and your role will include:

Provide leadership and management to the BI & Data team including coaching / mentoring

Manage the BI & Data budget of between $250m - $500m

Maintain an insightful understanding of the evolving technology and industry trends in the D&A landscape, and apply that insight to the development of our D&A strategy and solution portfolio, enabling us to best meet current and future requirements


Own Solution Design, Strategy, Architecture and QA review of Analytics Front End (SAP Fiori, WEBI, AFO, SAC and Tableau) and Backend (HANA modelling, Data ingest)

Partner with PGCS functional leads and business experts to identify and measure standard to fit KPIs

Implement best practice standards for Business Intelligence applications, promoting standardisation and re-usability of reporting solutions across PGCS

Maintain the catalog and documentation of PGCS analytical content such as Report master list, knowledge transfer decks etc.

Partner with Business functions across PGCS to determine data & analytics requirements, including those that require deep data science capabilities, plan and deliver solutions to meet their objectives and identify actionable insights and recommendations

Deliver effective support for BI systems, ensuring BI service levels are met

Manage the offshore D&A resources, evaluate the incoming requests, assess impact of those initiatives, prioritize the work for the team and drive implementation

Develop data visualizations, including reports, dashboards, and analyses to distribute data insights in an easily digestible manner to all relevant stakeholders

Support the Batch monitoring process for Global BI systems and ensure PGCS batch monitoring requirements are met


Develop the D&A user community, ensuring they are fully equipped with the knowledge to allow them to utilise the D&A solutions effectively and efficiently

Manage the implementation/deployment of new releases for BI – 2 to 4 week sprints for minor / incremental changes
Lead Sprint planning, retrospectives and other key ceremonies

Deliver and sustain the PGCS Data Quality application suite including reporting and mass update capability

Deliver tools to enable automation of Master Data setup and maintenance

Support the World Class Data (WCD) agenda and drive improved metrics through automation of rules and process improvements.

Manage the lifecycle of our Data & Analytics technologies and platforms, from creation, upgrade through to retirement

Ensure SAP user community has access to Master Data reporting and leverage BI and Data tools to deliver reporting and analytic capabilities
Qualifications/Requirements
Essential qualifications and/or experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Analytics, required, advanced degree or equivalent experience required
10+ years of related IT business work experience, including embedded analytics, SAP BW, SAP Business Objects, BW on HANA, SAC
8+ years of experience in global SAP and other ERP implementations, experience managing large global teams
5+ years of relevant professional experience in analytics, business intelligence, or project management roles
Strong technical aptitude and business acumen with demonstrated experience leveraging data from a multitude of sources to solve complex problems, tell a story and impact the overarching strategy
Expertise in integration architecture patterns to send data from SAP to Non-SAP systems
Willing to drive new initiatives and ability to drive multiple threads of work to completion
Provides outstanding customer service skills to direct and indirect customers
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization
Solves highly complex, politically sensitive problems across teams
Build and maintain strong relationships to achieve results through collaborative working
Strong financial management experience with proven ability to manage annual budget
Strong team leadership and management skills with the ability to develop teams and cultivate talent

Desired qualifications and/or experience
Experience in CPG industry preferred
SAP BI Expert

Experience with SAP Business Planning and Consolidations, Standard and / or Embedded

Expertise in large scale project delivery, leveraging Agile and DevOps

Experience in at least 2-3 value steams, including Forecast to Schedule, Order to Cash, Procure to Pay, Make to Deploy, Financial Planning & Analytics and Record to Report

3rd party Vendor Management expertise

Knowledge and experience in the following tools, disciplines and processes are nice to have SAP Solman 7+, MS Azure Dev Ops, Quality Centre and MS Project

Global perspective with ability to quickly understand individual local requirements

PepsiCo products are enjoyed by consumers more than one billion times a day in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. PepsiCo generated $70 billion in net revenue in 2020, driven by a complementary beverage and convenient foods portfolio that includes Lays, Doritos, Cheetos, Gatorade, Pepsi-Cola, Mountain Dew, Quaker, and SodaStream. PepsiCo's product portfolio includes a wide range of enjoyable foods and beverages, including many iconic brands that generate more than $1 billion each in estimated annual retail sales.
Guiding PepsiCo is our vision to Be the Global Leader in Beverages and Convenient Foods by Winning with PepsiCo Positive (pep+). pep+ is our strategic end-to-end transformation that puts sustainability at the centre of how we will create value and growth by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for planet and people. For more information, visit www.pepsico.com.
Relocation Eligible: Not Applicable

Job Type: Regular 
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Analytics, required, advanced degree or equivalent experience required
 10+ years of related IT business work experience, including embedded analytics, SAP BW, SAP Business Objects, BW on HANA, SAC
 8+ years of experience in global SAP and other ERP implementations, experience managing large global teams
 5+ years of relevant professional experience in analytics, business intelligence, or project management roles
 Strong technical aptitude and business acumen with demonstrated experience leveraging data from a multitude of sources to solve complex problems, tell a story and impact the overarching strategy
 Expertise in integration architecture patterns to send data from SAP to Non-SAP systems
 Willing to drive new initiatives and ability to drive multiple threads of work to completion
 Provides outstanding customer service skills to direct and indirect customers
 Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization
 Solves highly complex, politically sensitive problems across teams
 Build and maintain strong relationships to achieve results through collaborative working
 Strong financial management experience with proven ability to manage annual budget
 Strong team leadership and management skills with the ability to develop teams and cultivate talent

Desired qualifications and/or experience
Experience in CPG industry preferred
SAP BI Expert

Experience with SAP Business Planning and Consolidations, Standard and / or Embedded

Expertise in large scale project delivery, leveraging Agile and DevOps

Experience in at least 2-3 value steams, including Forecast to Schedule, Order to Cash, Procure to Pay, Make to Deploy, Financial Planning & Analytics and Record to Report

3rd party Vendor Management expertise

Knowledge and experience in the following tools, disciplines and processes are nice to have SAP Solman 7+, MS Azure Dev Ops, Quality Centre and MS Project

Global perspective with ability to quickly understand individual local requirements

PepsiCo products are enjoyed by consumers more than one billion times a day in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. PepsiCo generated $70 billion in net revenue in 2020, driven by a complementary beverage and convenient foods portfolio that includes Lays, Doritos, Cheetos, Gatorade, Pepsi-Cola, Mountain Dew, Quaker, and SodaStream. PepsiCo's product portfolio includes a wide range of enjoyable foods and beverages, including many iconic brands that generate more than $1 billion each in estimated annual retail sales.
Guiding PepsiCo is our vision to Be the Global Leader in Beverages and Convenient Foods by Winning with PepsiCo Positive (pep+). pep+ is our strategic end-to-end transformation that puts sustainability at the centre of how we will create value and growth by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for planet and people. For more information, visit www.pepsico.com. Experience in CPG industry preferred

Data & Analytics Business Partner (Location: Dublin – Ireland)
Purpose of role: The mission for the Data & Analytics team is to enable and empower our partners across the business to use high impact data & analytics tools, technologies, and methodologies to drive business insights & improve business outcomes.

As a Data & Analytics Business Partner, your key area of focus will be to facilitate collaboration between the Data & Analytics team and each of the business teams within your business domain to drive change and improve the quality of Data & Analytics services. You will also be responsible for collating and analysing available data to derive actionable insights and translate complex results into simple conclusions that will empower the business to act.

Reports to: Head of Data & Analytics (Location: Dublin – Ireland)

Key Responsibilities:

Lead on Partnering with Business Teams
Be the strategic Data & Analytics ‘Trusted Advisor’ partner to your group of business teams and have the ability to talk about data and analytics in a way that shows your stakeholders ‘what’s in it for them’.
Proactively identify, collate and validate the business opportunities that could be enabled by Data & Analytics products based on key business questions.
Act as a Subject Matter Expert by understanding business needs, scoping Data & Analytics requirements, synthesizing insights, and proposing solutions for the Data & Analytics team to deliver.
Own prioritisation and demand management for your business teams in regard to Data & Analytics product delivery.
Vision & Strategy
Provide a clear vision & strategy in how to lead your group of business teams toward a data-driven and insight-led culture, resulting in actionable insights that drive significant business impacts.
Communicate and influence stakeholders within the organisation to support the adoption and evolution of data and analytics products.
Work with business leaders to promote the use of data & analytics to support decision-making.

Delivery of Data & Analytics Products
With a combination of analytical expertise, data and system knowledge and business insight, you will answer and anticipate critical business questions and opportunities and deliver insights to the business in ways that make significant business impacts.
Deliver new Data & Analytics products & services, e.g., data visualisations and storyboards, as well as advanced analytical models, descriptive and predictive.
Improve the quality of existing Data & Analytics products and services.
Team Management, Collaboration and Relationship Building
Lead, manage and monitor the work of data analyst(s) to ensure effective implementation of projects to achieve all objectives.
Collaborate with the wider Data & Analytics team to deliver Data & Analytics products & services that deliver a high business impact.
Engage with Technology Product Domains in order to align on demand management and prioritisation across key business teams.
Enterprise Data & Analytics Platform
Identify and support the business in defining requirements to enable delivery of data and analytics products within the Enterprise Analytics Platform.
Provide innovative thought leadership to the data and analytics team and contribute points of view on Enterprise Analytics Platform strategy.
Contributing to the Data & Analytics Community
Support evolution of the Data & Analytics hub and spoke model to address business requirements and key business questions through delivery of Data & Analytics products.
Support the development of Data & Analytics skills and knowledge of spoke community members.
Promote cross functional ways of working in support of Data & Analytics initiatives ensuring adherence to standards and leading practices.
Encourage business user adoption of Data & Analytics products within your business domain.

Essential knowledge, skills, and experience:
A Bachelor or master’s degree in a quantitative field (Operation Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Math, Economics, Statistics, Analytics, Management/Business Information Systems (or related degree)
10+ years of demonstrable experience in related field, along with Team Management & Leadership experience
Knowledge of leading Analytics and BI platforms (e.g. Alteryx, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, IBM Cognos)
Hands on experience with at least one programming language (e.g. R, Python desirable)
Previous experience in large scale data warehousing, Teradata advantageous
Advanced SQL skills desirable
Advanced analytics experience – predictive modelling, statistical analysis, and machine learning (Supervised and unsupervised learning models like KNN, Random Forest, K-Means Clustering etc)
Proven experience with Data Science / Machine Learning Platforms (e.g. Alteryx, SAS, Databricks, IBM SPSS etc.)
Experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis with visualisation and analytics techniques to solve defined business problems
Up to date on large scale data, BI & visualisation technologies, trends and practices
Project management experience involving multiple stakeholders, and prioritising and delegating activities
Strong communications skills including the ability to deliver a clear story to influence agreement to your recommendations with data and insights.
The ideal candidate will have:
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to lead, influence and coach others.
An ability to question and challenge ensuring we are continuously improving our processes and measuring the right data
Excellent planning and organisation skills, ability to multi-task, plan and prioritise work schedule for self and team and work within agreed timescales.
Excellent attention to detail and an ability to analyse and interrogate high volumes of data as well as demonstrating an ability to focus on higher level overview.
Be a collaborative team player with excellent interpersonal/communication skills, while demonstrating high levels of emotional intelligence and possess the ability to push back with professionalism. Proven ability in developing effective working relationships across all levels of the organisation.
Operates with a high level of integrity, diplomacy, tact and professionalism.
Effective and persuasive presentation skills, including the ability to present complex information in an understandable manner to all areas of the business.
Sound judgement, unquestionable ethics and integrity with high degree of transparency and trust
Passionate about delivering Best in Class visualisations and analytics and applying previous knowledge to deliver excellent outcomes
Self-motivated to work with diverse business scenarios, handling multiple priorities and have a business & consultancy mind-set, while technically (data) savvy
Passion for discovering new things and ability to learn quickly Data & Analytics Business Partner (Location: Dublin – Ireland)

Data Analytics at EY
Data Analytics is one of the most exciting fields in today’s digital world. It offers challenging work, career development and great job satisfaction. EY’s mission is to build a better working world by asking better questions and finding better answers – this is what data analytics is all about. What better way to help us achieve our mission than by working with our data science teams as we continue on this journey.
Data Analytics is one of our strategic growth platforms with plans to grow from 150 people today to over 200 in the next 2 years. We are transforming our business by embedding analytics in everything we do. We are helping our clients transform their businesses by doing the same, across industry sectors and lines of business. We are growing and so are our people. We are hiring experienced professionals and graduates to work in a variety of roles. Apply today.
Data Analyst Senior/Consultant
Who are we?
At EY our purpose is to Build a Better Working World. We believe that the highest-performing teams maximize the power of different perspectives and backgrounds. These teams are both diverse and inclusive and are willing to invite and learn from other perspectives. Our ability to include various viewpoints into our mindsets, behaviours and operations is fundamental to driving innovation, building strong relationships and delivering the best solutions for our clients.
Our data analytics team focuses on helping our clients unlock value from their information assets through collaboration with domain experts across assurance, tax, transactions and consulting to embed innovative data analytics solutions in existing business areas.
The Opportunity
In response to strong market demand, we are seeking additional individuals to enhance our existing team. This is a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the Data Analytics team who are not only changing how we deliver services to our clients but are also committed to creating a diverse environment where EY people are valued, where they feel they belong and can contribute their best in every encounter.
Your Role and Responsibilities
Helping clients unlock value from their information assets through collaboration with domain experts to embed innovative data analytics solutions in existing business areas
Ability to take initiative and derive innovative solutions tailoring our insights and solutions to specific industry, sector and regulatory dynamics.
Collaborating effectively with multi-disciplinary teams across a range of industries helping our clients to transform and improve their business
Responsibility for a robust set of tools and infrastructure to sanitize, store and manipulate data (following leading standards for data security and privacy).
Performing statistical analysis and modelling using a variety of tools and programming languages and tell compelling stories to our clients through the application of Data Visualisation software
Applying predictive modelling techniques to key business issues faced by our clients that can transform and improve their entire organisation
Skills and attributes for success
Previous experience in a consulting or industry role
Strong academic record including a degree in a relevant, analytical discipline with an interest in data and a willingness to learn new skills and technologies
Effective communication skills with the ability to explain complex information using clear non-technical language
Continuously builds and masters key technical, functional and professional skills
A passion to contribute to the growth of the team, bringing energy, enthusiasm and the courage to lead and develop others
Demonstrates ability to direct and lead the activities of junior team members
Naturally inquisitive and analytically minded with the passion and ability to apply new techniques and knowledge to deliver insights and solve problems
Experience using any of the following programming languages such as R, Python; data manipulation tools including SQL or Data Visualisation software like Qlikview, PowerBI or Tableau.
What we offer
We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions.
Continuous learning:
You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
As you grow and develop here, you’ll discover opportunities to help customise your career journey, so that it’s as unique as you are.
Success as defined by you:
We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
We have embraced Hybrid working at EY adding greater flexibility and autonomy to the roles of our employees
Transformative leadership:
We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture:
Diversity is about differences. You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
CIPD 2020 Diversity and Inclusion Winner, GreatPlaceToWork’s Top 20 UK’s Best Workplaces for Women 2020 (Super Large Category) And Times Top 50 Employers for Women 2019 & 2020
To hear stories from professionals within our business around their experience, career advice and progression, and belonging and flexibility please visit us here.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Apply now.
EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

job_title: Senior Analyst - Data, Science & Engineering - Private Debt
listing_jobDesc:
StepStone is a rapidly growing Global Private Markets firm who provides customized investment and advisory solutions to some of the most sophisticated investors in the world. With $570 billion of total capital allocations, including $134 billion in AUM, we are highly diversified in the private markets across the globe and provide creative solutions to solve for the objectives of any investment program. With a culture built on entrepreneurialism, partnership and being a team within teams, our firm offers joiners the opportunity to think out loud, collaboratively.
Position Overview

The Senior Analyst of StepStone Private Debt – DSE will be responsible for maintenance and development of the company's Portfolio management system and the logic processes which drive it. The Senior Analyst will work with the members of the team to assist on various projects and innovations for the firm.

Essential Job Functions:
Data mine and analyse data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development and business strategies.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyse model performance and data accuracy.
Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems.
Carry out issue identification and analysis techniques, such as pattern analysis and root cause analysis, to help identify issues and propose solutions.
Plan, design and develop dashboards, ongoing reporting, and segmentation strategies.
Work close to stakeholders gathering requirements, performing analysis, and delivering complex analysis to supply data driven insight to support strategic business decision-making
Assist in development of the Logic behind the portfolio management system
Constantly identify areas for improvement
Analyse and process business data to address ad-hoc requests
Ad–hoc administrative & support tasks
Support other people within the team during absences

Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:
Possess a bachelor's degree (Computer Science, Data Analytics, Mathematics, Physics, or other technical/quantitative discipline), Masters' degree in above area is preferred
Relevant experience in computing/code writing environment (2+ years)
Demonstrable programming skills is a must (preferred T-SQL, VBA)
Experience with other computing languages (outside of those mentioned earlier) is a bonus
Data visualisation skills are a bonus

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Strong written and verbal communication skills
Flexibility—StepStone is a dynamic and entrepreneurial organization; all professionals are expected to perform multiple functions
Ability to prioritize activities while working on multiple projects and achieve target deadlines
Acute attention to accuracy and detail
Promote and demonstrate a positive, team‐oriented attitude
Dynamic, smart, enthusiastic, hard-working and a self-starter

Other Attributes:
Willingness to work a flexible schedule
High level of confidentiality
Commitment to learning

About us

Working out of 23 offices in 14 countries, StepStone has a truly global viewpoint. As people are our biggest asset, we offer resources to help our employees reach their full potential. Our principles are based on integrity, transparency, respect and creativity, which together define how we do business.

Join us

When you choose to work at StepStone, you'll find a group of professionals who are passionate about anticipating changes, solving problems and working together to make it all happen. Our integrated global team shares insights into how managers think and operate, as well as how they might perform.

Disclaimer / Policy Statements

At StepStone, diversity, equity and inclusion are an integral part of our culture. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees and allows them to be heard, regardless of title or tenure. Our organizational community features multiple Employment Resource Groups representing our dedication to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion.

Developing People at StepStone

Your employment will also be subject to various firm policies and guidelines, including return to workplace guidelines for your office (which require, where legally permitted, all U.S. employees to have their vaccinations against COVID-19 up to date in order to enter one of our offices or attend a firm-sponsored event). job_title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Deployment & MLOPs
listing_jobDesc:
Who We Are

Founded in 2005, 2K Games is a global video game company, publishing titles developed by some of the most influential game development studios in the world. Our studios responsible for developing 2K's portfolio of world-class games across multiple platforms, include Visual Concepts, Firaxis, Hangar 13, Cat Daddy, Cloud Chamber, and HB Studios. Our portfolio of titles is expanding due to our global strategic plan, building and acquiring exciting studios whose content continues to inspire all of us! 2K publishes titles in today's most popular gaming genres, including sports, shooters, action, role-playing, strategy, casual, and family entertainment.

Our team of engineers, marketers, artists, writers, data scientists, producers, thinkers and doers, are the professional publishing stewards of our growing library of critically-acclaimed franchises such as NBA 2K, Battleborn, BioShock, Borderlands, The Darkness, Mafia, Sid Meier's Civilization, WWE 2K, and XCOM.

At 2K, we pride ourselves on creating an inclusive work environment, which means encouraging our teams to Come as You Are and do your best work! We are dedicated to diversity and inclusion, and want our community of candidates to reflect this commitment. We encourage all qualified applicants to explore our global positions.

2K is headquartered in Novato, California and is a wholly owned label of Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTWO).

What We Need

You are an excellent software engineer and have an outstanding record of deploying and producing ML models, especially experience with deployment as prediction services. You also have decent experience and understand machine learning, including different types and tasks of ML algorithms, ML workflow, and common modeling/computing frameworks. Being a solution-oriented, creative problem solver; a self-starter with the passion and enthusiasm to drive initiatives for meaningful change, meet timelines, and build whatever is vital along the way is essential for this role. Capable and comfortable making architectural choices when working on sophisticated solutions consisting of multiple components.

What You Will Do
Collaborate with machine learning scientists, data engineers, tech, and game studios to deploy machine learning models as production-grade intelligent decision services and integrate with larger systems or products.
Build out robust Machine Learning Ops practices for the team and larger data science group. Advocate and champion engineering best practices within the data science community.
Design and quickly prototype AI / ML-powered products and services for various applications including recommenders, matchmaking, cheat/toxicity intervention, and economy balancing.
Work closely with game studio devs and central tech to plan and carry out integration solutions of AI /ML applications into games in time for launch.
What We Think Will Be A Great Fit
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or other related STEM fields.
3-4+ years of proven experience in software development/ or software engineering, combined with experience on machine learning deployment in production systems and running MLOps
Strong programming skills. Proficient in Python, plus at least one high-performance system programming language (C, C++, Java, Rust, …). Skilled with object-oriented and functional programming paradigms. Adaptable and quick to pick up the new language if needed.
Familiarity with common ML tasks, including supervised, unsupervised, and with reinforcement learning as a plus. Understanding of commonly used ML algorithms (traditional ML and deep learning). Ability to learn and understand new ML algorithms.
Solid understanding of machine learning modeling/computation frameworks such as sci-kit-learn, PyTorch, Tensorflow, or Spark ML
Experience with data technologies such as Relational and NoSQL databases, Hadoop, or Apache Spark.
Technically not a "skill", but you are comfortable with working hours 10am-6:30pm enabling greater connection with our US HQ
Nice To Have
Recommender systems, search engine, experimentation platform, matchmaking, or reinforcement learning technologies
Cloud computing platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure. Containers, container orchestration, serverless deployment, microservice architecture.
Stream data processing and related tools such as Apache Kafka, Kinesis, Spark Streaming
Major game engines such as Unreal or Unity.
Bonus Points

As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to ensuring that qualified individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform their essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us if you need reasonable accommodation.

Please note that 2K Games and its studios never uses instant messaging apps or personal email accounts to contact prospective employees or conduct interviews and when emailing, only use 2K.com accounts. Who We Are
