job_title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - World Class Tech Company
listing_jobDesc:
Job Overview

You will join a high-performing team developing leading-edge ML technologies running on advanced edge AI devices

A world-class tech company that invents, develops and commercializes solutions that you'll find in almost every technology product, from smartphones to cinemas.

An environment that empowers teams and enables employees to enjoy a healthy and productive work-life balance

Responsibilities

Develop innovative ML and Deep learning algorithms for Imaging and Multimedia applications running on advanced edge AI SOCs.
Apply ML to real-world problems selecting, designing, optimizing, and deploying neural networks across a wide range of Imaging and Multimedia use cases
Work with data teams to establish the training and testing datasets

Requirements

MSc degree in a relevant field with at least 2 years relevant industry experience in the development and productization of AI/ML technologies
Strong experience with applying ML & Deep learning to Imaging & Multimedia.
Expertise in deep learning-based object detection, segmentation, tracking
Experience with image processing, camera sensors and CV technologies.
Familiarity with state-of-the-art ML, conversant in the latest ML developments, neural network architectures, and training and optimization methods
Experience with deep learning development tools such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Caffe
Solid Python programming language skills
Familiarity with version control systems, preferably Git
Key Contact
James Roche

James Roach is a Senior IT Recruitment Consultant Job Overview

Familiarity with version control systems, preferably Git

EPAM is looking for a hands-on Lead Machine Learning Engineer to be part of the continued acceleration to strengthen our business in Western Europe.
We do not believe in collecting data without purpose. Analysis by seasoned experts can bring actionable information to organizations when they need it most. Whether our clients are looking to make better decisions for business development or create platforms and solutions that utilize data to streamline and improve operations—we are data-driven, business outcome oriented and we want to help our clients and partners by delivering innovative solutions to their most challenging problems.
What You’ll Do
Be responsible for the transition of machine learning algorithms to production environment and integration with enterprise ecosystem
Design, create, maintain, troubleshoot, and optimize the complete end-to-end machine learning life cycle
Write specifications, documentation, and user guides for developed solutions
Build frameworks for data scientists to accelerate the development of production-grade machine learning models
Collaborate with data scientists and engineering team to optimize the performance of ML pipeline
Constant improvement of SDLC practices
Exploration of new tools and techniques and propose improvements
Establish and configure CI/CD/CT processes
Design and maintain ML models continuous training
Provide capabilities for early detection of various drifts (data, concept, schema., etc,)
Promote and support MLOps practices
Continuously identify technical risks and gaps, devise mitigation strategies
Identify and eliminate technical debt in machine learning systems
What You Have
5+ years of different backend experience (any of Java, C#, Python, etc)
1+ years of experience building and working on search systems based on Elasticsearch, Solr, Lucene, Coveo, Vespa, etc
Understanding of query lifecycles, ingestion of the data. Knowledge of different built-in capabilities of those engines
Nice to have
Understanding of the cluster sizing, how to write custom plugins for Solr & Elasticsearch
Experience working with ETL tools such as Logstash, Talend, AWS Glue or similar
NLP experience (spacy, nltk, word2vec, etc)
Experience in different business domains (e-commerce, publishing, finance, etc.)
We offer
Competitive compensation depending on experience and skills
Opportunity to work on leading edge platforms, working in a fast-paced, agile, software engineering culture
Knowledge-sharing with colleagues from EPAM's global tech communities
Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
Regular performance feedback and salary reviews
Opportunities for professional growth
EPAM Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) (subject to certain eligibility requirements)
Some of these benefits may be available only after you have passed your probationary period

job_title: German Translator & NLP Analyst @ #1 Tech platform!
listing_jobDesc: Global Voice Technology assistant, a household name, is being developed & enhanced to better identify, understand and respond to accents & dialects in up to 12 languages.We are hiring skilled German Linguists that understand that language data is the underpinning of all current language technologies. Show more
This is a great opportunity to join Arm’s Machine Learning Software team, based in our Galway office in Ireland, working with teams and projects across Arm’s worldwide locations. You will work with cool technology, developing software which runs on many millions of Arm devices each day across different use-cases. The team develops Open-Source software which enables Machine Learning applications to run with high-performance on a wide range of Arm hardware platforms.
You will be joining a welcoming team that provides great support to new starters and builds opportunities for you to develop your skills across a range of technologies and roles within an Agile development environment. The team is open and collaborative, where you are encouraged to share your ideas and opinions to benefit the overall team.
If you would like to join us, don't delay! We look forward to receiving your application - and potentially welcoming you to Arm.
About you
The ideal person is someone with a keen problem-solving mind, passionate about software development and working as part of a team to deliver complex solutions in a dynamic field.
Essential skills and experience:
University Degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field
C++ and/or Python development experience in a production environment
Familiarity with developing on Linux or Android platforms
Experience working in an Agile team environment using continuous integration flows
Strong communication skills - in this role you will regularly share your work with wider teams within Arm
Desirable skills:
Experience with Machine Learning Frameworks and approaches (for example, TensorFlow or TensorFlow Lite)
Experience of working-in, or contributing-to Open-Source projects
Arm Core Beliefs
At Arm, we are guided by our core beliefs that reflect our culture and guide our decisions, defining how we work together to defy ordinary and shape extraordinary:
We not I
Take daily responsibility to make the Global Arm community thrive
No individual has the right answer. Brilliance is collective
Information is essential, share it
Realise that we win when we collaborate — and that everyone misses out when we don’t
Passion for progress
Our differences are our strength. Widen and mix up the pool of people you connect with
Difficult things can take unexpected directions. Stick with it
Make feedback positive and expansive, not negative and narrow
The essence of progress is that it can’t stop. Grow with it and be responsible for your own progress
Be your brilliant self
Be quirky not egocentric
Recognise the power in saying ‘I don’t know’
Make trust our default position
Hold strong opinions lightly
With offices around the world, Arm is full of diverse, dedicated, creative and hard-working engineers. By enabling an inclusive, meritocratic and open workplace where all our people can grow and succeed, we support our people to share their contributions to Arm's success in the global marketplace.
Arm has a responsibility to ensure that all employees are eligible to live and work in Ireland.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
#LI-JC1
Arm is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal opportunities are available to all applicants and colleagues. We are a diverse organization of dedicated and innovative individuals, and don’t discriminate on the basis of any characteristic. Show more

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.  
#LI-JC1 Show more

The Role
We are looking for a Data Product Owner to help us drive forward the data science and optimisation strategy in Ryanair. Working with over 70 data professionals and all areas of the business, it will be your job to be the link between the business and the data world. We are looking for an individual with in-depth domain knowledge to help better prioritize business opportunities and deliver world class solutions to the business.
We’re looking for an all-rounder – someone who is comfortable presenting to the CEO of the company, sitting with the business to find out what they really want and capable to challenging the tech teams to think beyond the obvious.
You will have the ownership of the backlog prioritisation and will work alongside the data management team to decide what should be built and when.
Definitely not a role for a wallflower!
The Person
Self-starter
Curious
Impactful communicator
Loves to own a project from beginning to end

Requirements
The Skills (not all are necessary):
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology or equivalent work experience.
5+ years experience in a Business Intelligence or similar team
Minimum 3 years’ experience in a product management role requiring setting priorities and defining new products
Experience in delivering multiple projects/ tasks in a dynamic environment
Be able to self-direct and handle multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
Programming languages related to data science, such as Python
Data architecture structures
Machine learning algorithms
UX and UI designs
Agile frameworks like Scrum
Experience in an aviation/travel or digital/e-Commerce environment would be highly advantageous
Our Tech Stack includes (but isn’t limited to):
Java, Python, Scala, R
AWS (S3, EC2, ECS, Lambda, EMR, RedShift), Docker, Elastic Search, Kibana,)
MS Azure
GCP Big Query
Benefits

job_title: Director, Data Science | Corporate Finance & Restructuring
listing_jobDesc:
Data Scientist- Director, Digital Science| Corporate Finance & Restructuring


About the Role:


We are expanding our Data Science team within FTI's Corporate Finance & Restructuring practice, addressing the growing data and analytics needs of both internal and external clients. Whether it be analysis and predictive models to facilitate growth initiatives / cost reduction or using a more granular data driven forecast approach, there is a desire to use data more intelligently to increase business benefits.
As a consultancy firm, we look to drive improved business performance; as a data science team, we look for interesting and advanced ways to do this. Our data scientists employ advanced mathematics, statistics, and computer science (ML and algorithmic), together with industry knowledge to tackle business problem for our clients. The team is technologically agnostic and has experience across a number of different tools.
If you are someone who is interesting in applying technical solutions to practical business problems as well as leading projects with technical, talented people and a wide range of business professionals then we would love to meet you. You should have a pragmatic approach to problem-solving and be capable of developing solutions that clients can rely on in production.

What you'll do:

Participate in varied data and analytics projects, from deep dive analysis and reporting to full model build, implementation and maintenance.Lead sections of a project; including managing a small team of data specialists, leading client engagements and managing project delivery.
• Participate in and shape business analysis activities to gather required requirements and inform data science and analytics solution design. • Undertake data discovery, exploratory data analysis and feature engineering.
• Apply machine learning and simulation techniques to provide insight for our clients; e.g. Logistic Regression, Random Forest, Neural Networks, etc. • Develop and test data pipelines working alongside data engineering specialists.
Work with client business leadership to ensure the commercial value from the analytics is realised.Partake in and shape analytics R&D work.Support business development activities and meet directly with clients.Mentor junior team members, provide coaching and support them in developing their careers.

How you'll grow:

As an employee, you can expect job satisfaction and intellectual challenges while working as part of a growing and developing team servicing clients across various sectors and industries.
As a business, we will invest in training and will support your development to ensure continuous enhancement of your skills and advancement in your career path, in addition to flexible mentorship across any part of FTI. Offering you a challenging but empowered environment to work in and accessibility to exceptional network in Fortune 500

Required:

Minimum 2.1 degree in Analytics, Data Mining, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or a related technical discipline.5 years' previous development experience in Data Science/BI/Project environments.Experience in SQL, Python, R, Scala, Tensorflow, PySpark or equivalent data science technologies.Previous experience in a consultancy or similar client facing environment.Advanced knowledge of Excel.Excellent consultative, communication, presentation and management skills.Entitlement to work in Ireland and the UK.

Desired:

Highly motivated, with a proven ability to work both separately and as part of a team with professionals at all levels and of various disciplines.Passionate about client service excellence.Experience in DevOps.Knowledge of MLs framework e.g. Torch, TensorFlow.Experience with cloud technologies i.e. AWS/Azure.Industry experience in Insurance, Banking, Financial Services, Software or Telecommunications.

Our Benefits

Apart from the well-structured career path and excellent team environment, our employees enjoy a variety of perks and benefits. We offer competitive benefits and wellbeing programme including private medical insurance, dental insurance, life insurance, income protection, flex critical illness cover, 5% employer pension contribution, holiday buy, paid volunteer hours and corporate matching for charitable donations, and much more.

About FTI Consulting What makes us unique? With more than 5,000 employees located in offices in every corner of the globe, we are the firm our clients call when their most important issues are at stake. Regardless of what level you are, you will have the opportunity to work alongside and learn from top experts in your field on high-profile engagements that impact history. Our culture is collaborative, and we value diversity, recognition, development and making a difference in our communities.
FTI Consulting is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange and has been recognized as a Best Firm to Work For by Consulting magazine and one of America's Best Management Consulting Firms by Forbes. For more information, visit www.fticonsulting.com and connect with us on Twitter (@FTI Consulting), Facebook and LinkedIn. FTI Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, protected veteran status, religion, physical or mental disability, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or e

#LI-WG2 Our Benefits


Apart from the well-structured career path and excellent team environment, our employees enjoy a variety of perks and benefits. Our benefits include, but are not limited to:

Competitive salary and bonus plans
Generous paid holidays and paid time off
Annual paid volunteer hours
Corporate matching for charitable donations
Free snacks and drinks

Overview:

At SolarWinds, we’re a people-first company. Our purpose is to enrich the lives of the people we serve—including our employees, customers, shareholders, Partners, and communities. Join us in our mission to help customers accelerate business transformation with simple, powerful, and secure solutions.
The ideal candidate thrives in an innovative, fast-paced environment and is collaborative, accountable, ready, and empathetic. We’re looking for individuals who believe they can accomplish more as a team and create lasting growth for themselves and others. We hire based on attitude, competency, and commitment. Solarians are ready to advance our world-class solutions in a fast-paced environment and accept the challenge to lead with purpose. If you’re looking to build your career with an exceptional team, you’ve come to the right place. Join SolarWinds and grow with us!
Your Role:
The role will be part of the Global Revenue Operations team responsible for the International Marketing Analytics at SWI and is the main point of contact to the International Marketing and Sales Leadership team.
This role will work closely with Marketing, Data Science and Sales teams to explore all avenues of inbound demand and extrapolate insights for teams to action on. We are looking for someone to be an informed voice for our data strategy to achieve operational excellence and own the integrated Marketing – Sales Funnel
Responsibilities:
Develop, manage, and analyze key revenue and marketing funnel metrics to drive revenue growth and enable forecasting
Proactively surface potential problems within the marketing funnel and work with Marketing/Sales leaders to create action plans through the GTM Interlock process
Help lead a cross-functional team focused on improving Marketing attribution modeling
Build out ROI models that can be used by marketing program owners to understand the efficacy of their programs
Maintain consistent reporting cadences across the marketing org and use our data to communicate performance, areas for improvement, and shared successes or failures
Distill large datasets into actionable insights for teams by building dashboards in reporting/analytic platforms for proactive and reactive needs
Deliver actionable ad-hoc intelligence and recommendations to leaders as needed
Work cross-functionally with teams to unify and streamline data available to and from new tools and sources
Partner tightly with Data Science to ensure processes and best practices are set to maintain the integrity of inbound data
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, high growth environment
Qualifications:
7+ years of experience in Marketing Operations or Analytics
High level of comfort in manipulating/joining large data sets from different sources
Experience with different marketing attribution methodologies
Extensive experience in Excel data modeling
Proficiency in SFDC, Outreach, Tableau or other data visualization applications
Self-motivated individual who is always looking for opportunities to optimize processes
Excellent communication skills with a proven ability to tell a story with data to all levels of the organization
Results-oriented, creative, resourceful, detail-oriented, and highly organized
BA or BS in a quantitative field (marketing, economics, math, computer science, finance, etc.) Overview:
